About Pilfering Pandas
The pandas have decided they want freedom and are plotting their escape from the zoo. The nefarious meerkats have agreed to help them in exchange for food. You must pilfer the unwanted food from the other animals without arousing the suspicion of the zookeeper. If they become too suspicious your escape attempt is doomed for failure. 
Pilfering Pandas is a modern reinvention of a classic set collection card game that requires carefully timed & targeted actions. The key to winning is knowing when to sneak and pilfer more unwanted food from the Hideout (a spread of cards visible to all players) and when to stay put. Getting this wrong can be costly or even disastrous.
Pilfering Pandas has 3 game modes:
 Competitive: Players each attempt to make their escape, individually trying not to attract too much attention while hindering the escape attempts of their fellow pandas.
 Cooperative: All players work together to escape, always trying to stay one step ahead of the Zookeeper.
 Solo: Working on your own, your job is to get the help you need from the Meerkats and make your escape before the Zookeeper notices.
Although the gameplay in Pilfering Pandas is easy to understand the strategy is harder to master. This means Pilfering Pandas is suited to both adults who like quick games but with lots of decision making as well as families (cooperative recommended for under 12s).
Wren Games is the wife and husband team Janice & Stu. As parents of 2 young children,we understand how hectic life can get, so we wanted to create a game that is accessible for busy people. Pilfering Pandas is our third game which aims to provide:
 Short playtimes. 
 Depth of decisions. 
 Intuitive gameplay. 
We have multiple options for you to try before you buy including our very own solo implementation in the form of a digital app that's free to play throughout this Kickstarter. Get an overview of the rules here and then keep scrolling down to find out more about our app.
We also have these 4 gorgeous hard enamel pin badges (approx 1.5 in) up for grabs featuring the fabulous game art. We couldn't resist! 
If you prefer watching to reading, here's a good video summary of Pilfering Pandas so you can learn all about this addictive little game. 

Pilfering Pandas is a reinvention of a classic card game Janice played with her nan growing up (she knows it as Benny - tell us in the comments if you've heard of it!). 
At its core, Pilfering Pandas is a set collection game, but it's not your typical set collection game. We've added lots of twists added to bring about a brisk game with depth to decisions. 
To achieve this depth, we've made a ton of changes, not least creating cooperative and solo modes. Pilfering Pandas plays similarly in all 3 game modes but with some key  differences making each game mode a different experience. 
A typical turn on the surface looks deceptively simple, making Pilfering Pandas quick and easy to teach to others. However the strategy is harder to master. A turn will look something like this: 
Pick up 1 or more cards.
Play sets to the table and/or pass.
Advance marker(s).
Discard a card.
Sets of 3 or more cards can be played in any of the following ways:
So at this point you might be thinking, isn't this just Rummy? And the answer is no, it's a lot more than Rummy. Here are a few of the key differences:
Sets are played to the table (Meerkats) and not kept in hand.
There's no hand limit or action limit.
You can pick-up more than 1 card from the discard pile (Hideout).
To play a new set, you must match the suit or number of the last card in the previous set played.
You can chain sets, doubling points if you reuse a card in an already played set.
Each player has a special power or challenge based on their pandas character.
A wild card in a set can be taken back (or stolen) or discarded to slow down the zookeeper.
In cooperative and solo games, the zookeeper is constantly chasing you.
 The Hideout 
Perhaps the most interesting mechanism in Pilfering Pandas is the Hideout. The Hideout is where you 'discard' a card at the end of your turn, but unlike traditional discard piles, the Hideout is not a pile, it's a spread of cards visible to all players. For a fee, you can pick up as many cards as you want from it,  making huge plays of sets in a single turn possible (there's only a hand limit in solo games). 
The Hideout acts like a communal hand in cooperative games (like an extension of your hand in solo games) where you all work together to build sets ready for one lucky person to pick up. However, the strategy is reversed  in competitive gameplay. Not only are you looking for cards in there that you might want, but you are also actively trying to prevent any sets being created that one of the other players could grab before you do. This means you should think carefully before discarding that card your opponent might be looking for! 
Competitive Gameplay 
In competitive gameplay, players attempt to make their own escape, trying not to attract too much attention from the zookeeper and making sure no other pandas escape. There can be only one panda on the loose.
Cooperative Gameplay
In cooperative gameplay, all players work together to escape, always trying to stay one step ahead of the zookeeper who automatically advances 1 space every turn. What you do on your turn directly affects how much closer you are to escaping, as well as how much closer the zookeeper gets to catching you.
Solo Gameplay
In solo gameplay, you are working on your own to ensure the escape of the pandas from the zoo. Your job is to get the help you need from the Meerkats and make your escape before the Zookeeper notices.

Why are the ranges so large for shipping costs?
Shipping is the trickiest thing to estimate during a Kickstarter, especially now. We've done our very best to give you the most transparent view based on the quotes we have but we can't predict the future. This is why the ranges in some cases are quite large. The differences between suppliers are large and we cannot guarantee that the cheapest supplier will hold that price until we fulfil. 
We will use the most cost effective shipping method when the time comes, but with COVID surcharges,  we just don't know what the cost will be in 6-9 months time. Therefore the above are rough estimates of shipping costs, but we're confident we won't go above the upper limits and when we come to contracting a fulfilment centre, we will be targeting the lower end of the range.

campaign.story:
These quick jolts of extreme puzzling fun await everybody!
Every day (including weekends) for 13 weeks you’ll get a 9×11 easy-to-medium crossword whose answer contains all 26 letters. They will be written by Peter Gordon and Frank Longo. The puzzles will be delivered to your email inbox in two forms: Across Lite, which can be solved on your computer, smartphone, or tablet; and pdf, which can be printed and solved on paper. All this for less than 11¢ a puzzle.
Sample Puzzles
Here are two sample puzzles. To try them, right-click on the image and open it in a new tab, and then print it. Or download Across Lite versions: Sample #1, Sample #2. (Answers can be found here: Answer #1, Answer #2.)
Go here to sign up after the deadline.

About Us
Peter Gordon started Fireball Crosswords in 2010 as the first online-only pay-to-play direct-to-the-solver crossword. He has written or edited more than 50 puzzle books, with combined sales of over a million copies. He was the editor of the Post Puzzler, a tough themeless crossword that appeared in every Sunday Washington Post from April 2010 to March 2015. From 2002 to 2008, he was the crossword editor for The New York Sun. He was the editorial director for Puzzlewright Press, an imprint of Sterling Publishing, where he worked for 23 years. He is also the creator of the iPhone app Celebrity: Get a Clue. Gordon was a member of the American Heritage Dictionary Usage Panel from 2012 until its demise in 2018. In 2017, New York Times best-selling author A.J. Jacobs called him “a six-letter word starting with MENS and ending in CH.”
Frank Longo is a full-time puzzle professional living in Hoboken, New Jersey. He creates the weekly Sunday Premier Crossword and the daily Cryptoquip for King Features Syndicate. His work also appears regularly in Games World of Puzzles magazine. His various puzzle books include Cranium-Crushing Crosswords, Mensa Crosswords for the Super Smart, Point & Solve Crosswords, The World’s Longest Crossword Puzzle, Vowelless Crosswords, Scrabble Crosswords, and over 150 sudoku and Wordoku books.
Together we’ve written Puzzlewright Guide to Solving Sudoku, Scrabble-doku, and Stupendous Scrabble Sudoku.

campaign.story:
The Escape Advent Calendar 
Beautifully designed calendars that give you the excitement of an Escape Room with the daily reward of chocolate during your countdown to Christmas.

With a new design from last year... 
An Advent Calendar combined with the puzzles of an Escape Room.

This project follows in the footsteps of our successful Kickstarter project last year,  you can check it out here.

WHAT IS AN ESCAPE ROOM?
An Escape Room is a brick and mortar location where you and your team must escape the room by solving the clues, puzzles and riddles. Since lockdown we have been looking at ways to bring the experience to your home at an affordable price, solving clues to get through a door without being locked in a room, truly...thinking outside the box.

"I bought this calendar for an early teen and they loved it. The puzzles were excellent. We are definitely buying again for next year!! "     - Customer review

Each A3 sized calendar has a unique design that will engage your mind with an array of Christmas related puzzles.  Some will be quick to solve, some have to be unscrambled and some may need to be decoded with the help of the back of the advent calendar. 



WHO ARE WE?
We are Escape Room designers who have been creating Escape Room experiences in Peterborough UK. We have created brick and mortar Escape games, mobile team challenges and started the Escape Advent Calendars last year.

We enjoy designing puzzles that create that fist pump moment upon solving and leave you wanting to play more.

"Loved the variety of puzzles and that when you "got it" you got it! " - Customer review

 WHAT ARE THE CALENDARS?
Last year we came out with 2 designs and we have learnt a lot since then, we have taken your comments and feedback and looked into pushing the boundaries of puzzle design within the calendar concept. Here are our two new themes...
A new theme - Escape the Christmas Closet
 "Honestly this has been one of my favourite finds of 2020. " - Customer review
A new theme - All Wrapped Up
 Your pledge will help bring these calendars from completed artwork into the production stage and to your front door. We know it is very early to be thinking of Christmas, this campaign needs us to be prepared for the manufacturing process and delivery to bring the calendar to you by December 1st.


 WHAT'S NEW?
New mechanics
With this new design it can enable the doors of the Advent Calendar to come off instead of being on a hinge. 
Why is this important? It means that more puzzles can be made, it opens up the area inside the advent window to be an extra playable area. The detached door can now be used elsewhere on the calendar, cut up or folded to find the solution.

"The mix of puzzles was great. It's fantastic that the two calendars did not have the same puzzles. Can't wait for next year! "  - Customer review
* Cutting and folding puzzles only available on Escape the Christmas Closet
HOW DO THE PUZZLES WORK?
 "Awesome calendars! I bought both calendars, one for me and one my wife. We have both loved completing the puzzles every day, such a cool idea!"  - Customer review 


“We LOVED these calendars! Can’t wait for next year’s!” - Customer review

 YOUR PLEDGE WILL HELP
The artwork for the calendar is complete and the digital files are ready to be sent to the manufacturer. The production and assembly time on the calendars will be about 8 weeks and we plan to send them out to you by November 2021. We have worked very hard over the last year to bring you an affordable product that will bring you joy this Christmas.
 This is the second Kickstarter we have started and can manage your pledges to provide a quality product on time.  We have launched this Kickstarter a little earlier this year to make sure we have enough time for manufacturing and delivery.
ADD ON prices are adjusted to give you the best value on your reward order.

 WANT SOME MORE?.... TRY OUR ADD-ON STORE

This campaign is mainly for our new calendars, however we know you like puzzles and we do have two more themes you may be interested in. Maybe you played them before and want to give them to a friend or you are wanting to try all of our products... you can just ADD ON to your reward at our Kickstarter price.
When you pledge for a reward you can add on one or as many as you want of our other themes. 'Escape the Advent Calendar or Mystery of the Half-Eaten Carrots. This will add to the delivery cost of your reward, we have adjusted the delivery price for the reward amounts.
 Here is a quick brief of all our themes available, they each have a different story, puzzles and layout of chocolate.


Image shows mailer for 1 calendar, mailers can hold up to 4 calendars each.

Available to backers in PDF version - End of November 2021
Will fit inside cardboard mailer for your calendar reward delivery.

Thank you so much for looking at our calendars, we hope that you enjoyed reading about our journey and will pledge to see it cross the finish line. Whether your pledge is a little or alot, it all helps to bring our dream to your front door. We hope you love playing them as much as we enjoyed designing them. Please share our story so we can keep designing more every year. We thank you for your support and keep puzzling.

campaign.story:
Our intrepid author Paige Turner is back!  In Paperback Adventures, you get to play as the protagonist in one of Paige's wild brainstorming sessions. Conquer a menagerie of pulp novel characters in this solo deckbuilding word game.
Just like in the original game Paperback—and its follow up, Hardback—you will build your own deck of cards throughout the game, and those cards will have letters to help you spell words every turn. But in Paperback Adventures, instead of testing your wordsmithing wit against other players, you will use your words to defeat a series of AI enemies in "roguelike" fashion.
Paperback Adventures is a solo-focused game. It was designed from the ground up as a strategic, highly-replayable solo word game. There are also additional gameplay variants for cooperative play between two players.
Here are the stretch goals we've unlocked!
Community Stretch Goals
Part of what makes Kickstarter great is the opportunity to hear what matters most to backers. Here are some of the additions and changes we’ve made thanks to our backers’ feedback.
As the game developed and grew, we wanted every character to have their own cards and unique styles of play, but with the Fowers Games history of small box games we also wanted to keep an affordable price point for the game. So we decided on a modular system that lets you play the game whether you buy one character or several.
Here's what the Paperback Adventures core box contains:
Rulebook
Enemy Tray with Tokens (designed by Game Trayz™)
12 Enemy Cards
12 Reward Cards
7 Penalty Cards
7 Enemy Vowel and "?" Cards
26 Item Cards
26 McGuffin Cards
7 Penalty Card Sleeves
As long as you have at least one character box, the core box contains everything else you need to play the game. The core box also has space to store the bonus content from each of your character boxes (note: not all content from those boxes), allowing you to set up a new game more quickly.
So what comes in a character box? Each protagonist in Paperback Adventures plays distinctly, with different core items, starting items, and a unique 10-card starting deck. Additionally, every protagonist has their own growth deck of 50 cards that offers different paths and playstyles every game session.
But a character box doesn't only provide new content when you choose that character. Inside each character box you'll also find a few new enemies and a few new bonus items and McGuffins that go into your core box and add additional content no matter which character you pick for a given game.
Each character box has bonus enemies, items, and double-sided McGuffins (like this one!)
The more character boxes you add, the more variety and wacky combinations you get. 
Here's what comes in each character box:
Character Tray with Tokens (designed by Game Trayz™)
Character Card
6 Enemy Cards
6 Reward Cards
60 Letter Cards
6 Core Item Cards
4 Bonus Item Cards
4 Bonus McGuffin Cards
60 Letter Card Sleeves
The protagonists are not only unique from a gameplay standpoint, they also come from wildly different genres and have their own graphical style and artistic design. Here are the playable characters in Paperback Adventures:
Our final character is a Pirate—he is currently awaiting a proper name to be voted on by the backers!
Word-heavy playstyle
Barrage cards get bonuses for longer words
Can drain the enemy's life!
Can copy the effect of an item—effectively using it twice
Crew cards come back from the fatigue pile
Try out the Tabletop Simulator demo on Steam!
In a single game of Paperback Adventures, your protagonist will face off against nine randomized enemies of escalating difficulty.  To make matters worse, your health total persists from enemy to enemy. Luckily for you, each enemy also offers randomized rewards to help you power up quickly to meet the challenge. 
You'll need to beat each enemy one by one by spelling words with the cards in your hand. Each card has symbols that either damage the enemy, block the enemy's incoming damage to you, or provide you with mana so you can use your items. You'll also be able to activate the unique ability of one of your cards.
The game is divided in a trilogy structure, where you'll battle two normal enemies and a boss for each "book" in the trilogy. You can stop a game session after completing one book (~45 min) or even after any enemy through a "save game" feature that will keep your current deck, items, and rewards separate in the game's box. To beat the game, you'll need to defeat all nine enemies in the trilogy.
One goal from the outset of this game's design was to find ways to streamline the typical deckbuilding roguelike experience found in digital games for tabletop play. Two essential systems deliver the gameplay variation and combos needed for the genre while keeping player upkeep at a minimum: the splay system and the hex and boon counter system.
Your word is ready—which way will you splay?
 When you spell words each turn in Paperback Adventures, you'll need to also choose which way to splay your word, so that only one edge of each card is showing except for the top card. The only card ability visible will be on the top card, and that's the ability you activate. Here's an example of how it works:
When you splay left, you count all the icons on the left edge of each card. The top card is the last letter of the word.
When you splay right you count all the icons on the right edge of each card. The top card is the first letter of the word.
The splay system forces you to make tough choices—do you want more blocks or more hits this turn? Or maybe which card is your top card matters most. To make that decision even tougher (and to keep every battle moving), the top card also gets fatigued for the rest of the battle. You'll get it back for the next enemy, though!
Hex and boon counters allow protagonists and enemies to support a wide range of playstyles without adding too many rules and overhead for players to track. Hex counters affect the character they are on negatively, while boon counters affect the character they are on positively. So these counters are always contextual--one enemy's hex counters might cause accelerating damage, while another enemy's hex counters limit your card draw.
Here is a link to the current working rulebook for Paperback Adventures
We know that some players will want a tougher challenge, especially after completing a few runs. So we’ll be including a system called Plot Twists.
Every Plot Twist comes with two distinct challenges, one on top and one on bottom, for the entirety of your run. Here is one condition card unlocked earlier in the campaign:
Each challenge has a difficulty number assigned to it, with “1” being the lowest difficulty. Before starting a run, you can choose an overall challenge level for your run and then mix and match challenges from the various Plot Twists until the collective difficulty numbers add up to your desired challenge level. This way, you can experience brand new challenge combinations while also making the game better fit your experience and skill level.
You can splay the Plot Twists underneath your player tray, showing only the new rules from your chosen challenges so that you can quickly reference them. Those rules will stay the same throughout your run.
While Paperback Adventures was designed from the start as a solo experience, we also knew that people would enjoy playing it with others. We’ve been playtesting and working behind the scenes to bring some two player variants to the table that not only open up a seat for an additional player but also open up new ways to approach the game.
Two-Headed Giant
This cooperative mode really leans into the idea of co-op play. The two players must work in tandem using the same character, deck, and token tracker. But here’s the kicker: you split your starting items and McGuffins between the two of you. Additionally, you alternate taking turns, which means your items and McGuffins are only available half the time. Anytime you gain an item or McGuffin, you both gain one!
A lot of the fun in this variant comes from working together to find the best words and setting each other up for big turns. Don’t just take our word for it though; check out this gameplay video where we show off the mode over a couple different enemy fights.
Double Trouble
In the Double Trouble mode, each player has their own character to play! They team up against a pair of enemies, but they must coordinate their attacks and share certain resources—like the wild card!  (To make this possible, one enemy uses the tray from the unused character.)
 Paperback Playthrough with Aaron of GameEnthus and designer Skye Larsen
Playthrough from a Live Stream with Ruel Gaviola on Tabletop Tonight
Book 2 Gameplay from a Live Stream with Richmond of BramBeard Gaming
Jason Perez with One Stop Co-op Shop
You won't get too far in a roguelike without sweet loot. Reward cards for each enemy will give you two options to choose from. You have to choose which set of loot is more important to keep progressing.
Items provide powerful effects that can be used once per turn, but you'll need mana to activate most of them.  
Examples of a McGuffin and item with completed art
McGuffins are always double-sided, and you'll get to choose which McGuffin will help you more. These powerups provide modest effects, but don't require mana for use. Find the right ones for some spectacular combos!
Every character letter card is also upgradeable. When a reward says you upgrade a card, flip the card over and put it back in its sleeve. Some card upgrades add extra icons to the card, while others improve or even alter the card ability.

campaign.story:
From Gloomhaven to Blood Raven, nerds are passionate about a lot of things… but there's one thing they love above all else, and that is correcting people. 
CollegeHumor is joining forces with Wiggles 3D to bring you the long-awaited home version of their popular game show, Um, Actually! Featuring 100% new questions never seen on the show before!
Um, Actually presents you with statements about the fictional worlds of popular movies, TV shows and books. They all sound right... but listen carefully, because each one has a mistake hidden in it somewhere! It's your job to figure out what's wrong and announce it before anyone else, starting, of course, with the magic phrase: "Um, actually..." 
But even if you know nothing about Sailor Moon or Star Wars, you'll find yourself making wild guesses, stumbling into answers, and having laughs along the way!
Check out this episode to see how a game goes down:

We’ve got lots of exciting stuff planned for this campaign! 
Over the next few weeks, we’re going to be building a custom deck of questions with input from you, the backers, so don't forget to GET IN THE COMMENTS! We’re calling it the Community Deck, and it will be included in every copy of the Community and Deluxe Editions of the game.

Here’s what you can look forward to in the coming weeks:
These weekly polls will pit card ideas against each other and call on you to vote on which one you would rather see in the Community Deck. Would you rather have John Woo or John Wick? Cloverfield or Garfield? Each week we'll do an update with a link to a poll where you can make your voice heard. Sweet democracy in action!
Each week, we’ll issue challenges that will allow you to offer your support for one of two categories you’d like to see in the Community Deck. You might be asked to act something out, take a crazy photo, or even cobble together a quick cosplay outfit. Check in each Wednesday to learn about that week’s challenge, then get creative and post your efforts on social media!
We’ll be announcing a new engagement piece every Friday, each one designed to test your knowledge of all things nerdy! From getting in the game, to scoring some swag, engage with your fellow nerds and get rewarded for it. 
We can’t wait to see what you guys come up with!
Not convinced by our fancy graphics and flashy video? Well, we asked our friends to say nice things about the game... so let's hear what they think!
PLAY

Not familiar with the show? Watch some clips and full episodes below!
You can watch every episode of Um, Actually - along with exclusive series like Dimension 20 and Game Changer on CollegeHumor's streaming service, Dropout.tv. You can also watch a number of classic free episodes on the Um, Actually YouTube channel.


If you're one of the awesome folks who backed a previous Wiggles 3D Kickstarter project, such as 5-Minute Dungeon or 5-Minute Mystery, we'd like to express our heartfelt thanks.
Thanks. No, really. Thanks so much for supporting us!
And as another way of expressing our gratitude, we'd like to offer each and every one of you a free 2-month subscription to Dropout and a CA$ 5 credit, which can be applied against shipping charges or add-ons in the pledge manager after the campaign!
Dropout is College Humor’s premier content streaming service, with lots of great shows like Dimension 20, Game Changer, and of course, Um, Actually!
You'll be able to claim this gift at the end of the campaign, when you complete your backer survey.
Limit one per returning backer.
We will be charging shipping once the Kickstarter is over as part of your backer survey in BackerKit. 
We will be shipping from depots in the USA, Canada, the UK, Germany, China, and Australia. We'll choose the nearest depot to you to minimize the chances of additional duty and taxes. Shipping to countries other than the ones where we have depots may result in additional charges out of our control. Please research import regulations to learn about these potential costs for your country before placing an order. 
European and UK VAT and Canadian HST are included in the shipping charges given below. 
Each pledge must be shipped to a single delivery address. We cannot split pledges to ship to multiple addresses.
Actual shipping costs are higher than our charged rates. We subsidize shipping to keep rates affordable for backers.

Currency Conversions
Remember that your pledge is in Canadian Dollars, and your card will be billed in Canadian Dollars when the campaign ends. Currency exchange rates change regularly. Look at your local currency exchange rate toward the end of the campaign for the most current price.
Once again, we'll be partnering with BackerKit to make it much easier for backers to manage their pledge choices and shipping information.
After the campaign ends, we'll send you a BackerKit survey asking you to provide your shipping information so we can get your rewards to you. You'll have the opportunity to add more copies of the game... at the same price as during the Kickstarter.
If you operate a game store and think that your customers would love Um, Actually, we'd love to hear from you! Shoot us an e-mail at info@wiggles3d.com.

Wasted Wilds funded on Day 1 in about an hour and have gone on to make this the most funded Rock Manor Games Kickstarter EVER thanks to over 3000 backers!  Wasted Wilds has unlocked all 22 stretch goals, including 4 new apocalypses (Plantpocalypse, Smart Apes, Underground, Fascist Soldiers), component upgrades, a huge supplemental mission book, legacy campaign content and an additional survivor in the Beekeeper. 
Maximum Apocalypse: Wasted Wilds is the much anticipated continuation of the hit cooperative roguelike game series. It features the same compelling survival gameplay but adds two distinct campaigns with a lot of new twists around exposure to the elements and interactions with other survivors. 
Wasted Wilds can be played as a stand-alone 1-4 player campaign, or combined with the contents of any other Maximum Apocalypse game or expansion to support up to 6 players.  Survivors from Maximum Apocalypse, Kaiju Rising, Gothic Horrors and Jurassic Perils are all fully playable in this game. Plus any of the new survivors from Wasted Wilds can be played in the other Maximum Apocalypse games as well!
If you're unfamiliar with Maximum Apocalypse, it is a cooperative roguelike game filled with adventure, exploration, survival and strategic choices. It was built from the ground up to be very modular and infinitely replayable.  Maximum Apocalypse has inspired a Role Playing Game and spawned numerous expansions featuring everything from Bugs, C'thulhu and Kaiju. There is a vast wasteland out there to explore and Wasted Wilds has been designed as the perfect starting point! The Frozen Wilds campaign walks players through a mission by mission tutorial that will ease new players into the experience.
This graphic does not include additional Stretch Goal Content (see below)
We always like to offer more to our Kickstarter backers. We're going to try something new for this campaign and will be giving everyone the opportunity to vote and influence the path we take on this crowdfunding adventure together.  Over the course of the campaign, the community will not only direct which stretch goals come next, but also unlock and design some of that content together. Be sure to check the campaign daily!
Wasted Wilds features a brand new set of survivors with all new skills and mechanics, along with new apocalypses, enemies and two distinct campaigns.  Here is a quick rundown of what's new in Wasted Wilds:
 The Driver is an impulsive ex-stuntwoman who relies on her adrenaline to get her through tough situations.  She comes with her own custom car that can mow down enemies and can even move the Van tile for easier escapes.
 The Chef is a support class who uses his knowledge of the kitchen to aid his fellow survivors.  He focuses on staving off hunger and is deadly with his many knives.
 The Contractor is a strong warrior with a big appetite.  His innate ability allows him to build barricades which prevent future monster spawns.
 The Thief is a stealthy rogue who evades danger and strikes from the shadows.  She grows in strength as she makes her way through her 50 card survivor deck, setting up crucial assassinations.

The Frozen Wilds & Scorched Wasteland
Wasted Wilds focuses on the environmental impact of apocalyptic events such as Nuclear Winter and Global Warming.  There are two distinct campaigns: The Frozen Wilds and Scorched Wasteland, that task players with surviving many different types of apocalypses, monsters and events as you progress through each campaign.  Our Mission Book and Learn to Play guide makes learning the game and its new mechanics easy for new and old players alike.  Each mission explains setup, shows example map layouts, lists each objective and how to escape with your life:
Our Learn to Play Guide simplifies the rule set and eases players into the experience. As you progress through the Frozen Wilds campaign, you will slowly be introduced to new game mechanics and threats such as exposure to elements, parlaying with other tribes of human survivors, monster tokens moving during the day and night effects.

Time is Against You!
Wasted Wilds organizes its new mechanics into a Clock board.  Time is always ticking along in Wasted Wilds. Every turn advances the clock, but rolling a '7' increases the passage of time and might trigger Exposure or another effect!
Exposure: Survivors will be facing extreme conditions and will need to stay inside to avoid exposure to the elements.  Survivors that are exposed (located on outdoor tiles) will draw negative status effects from the Exposure deck. It might start off as frostnip, but can grow into pneumonia or worse.  The Exposure deck allows us to introduce apocalyptic dangers outside of the traditional monster deck.
Don't get stuck outdoors when Exposure strikes
Day/Night: Day and Night effects were introduced in the Gothic Horrors expansion. During the day, monster tokens move around the map.   When Night falls, events trigger that will help or hinder your progress.
Parlay with NPCs to get them on your side
Tribes: The biggest enemy that you will face in Wasted Wilds is humanity itself.  Groups of survivors have created their own tribes.  These enemies are more complex than your standard apocalyptic monsters, you can parlay with them and trade items to turn their opposition into an alliance.

Streamlined Setup
Everything in Wasted Wilds aims to get players into the game quicker. All of the hard-to-organize map tiles have been streamlined into a "scorched" and "frozen" set that you can easily keep separate and store between missions using our storage system. There's no need to search through all the map tiles to get the right set for a mission any longer.
This is also true for the Scavenge Decks.  The Red, Green and Blue scavenge decks are the same for every mission in Wasted Wilds.  We've made sure that every scavenge card features a colored icon indicating which deck it belongs to so that you can easily sort them. Each Scavenge deck can then be stored in the correct storage tray between play sessions for faster setup.
The Time Traveler Expansion, designed by Todd Walsh (Set a Watch) and inspired by his love of Sci-Fi, features a quirky survivor who is great at avoiding combat. Whenever the Traveler is used, you also introduce their Time Pod tile, which you can use to teleport around the map.  Of course when you rip through space time there are bound to be consequences. You will have to watch out for time anomalies as well...
Step inside the mind of Gustav Rangmar, the artist behind Maximum Apocalypse, for the creation of its memorable characters, imaginative creatures and post-apocalyptic world. The Art of the Apocalypse is an amazing collection for fans of the series. It gives you a glimpse into the creative process, Gustav's favorite pieces, and all of the work that goes into crafting a game world like this one throughout its 120+ pages.  
The Redhead first appeared as a promotional Gunslinger in the very first Maximum Apocalypse campaign. Now, she's finally getting a proper expansion focused on the lore of the indie comic of the same name. The Few and Cursed Expansion features the Redhead's "Curse Chaser" deck from the Few and Cursed board game along with new monster decks and tiles that focus on a new 'Cursed' status effect. Special Thanks to Felipe Cagno and Fabiano Neves on trusting us with their IP and making this idea happen!
The Allies of the Rapture expansion compiles all of the extra Kickstarter Exclusive content from our previous campaigns. This includes the solo focused Allies expansion, the Rapture apocalypse, murder clowns and gremlin monsters. If you missed out on the KS version of Gothic Horrors, this expansion is for you! This content is already included in the Legendary Edition.
Last but not least we will have new Wasted Wilds play mats available for bundling in the pledge manager:
We will be offering other Maximum Apocalypse products like the Legendary edition, Gothic Horrors Kickstarter edition, RPG books etc. in the pledge manager, but their quantity will be limited based on existing stock in each region. You can also visit shop.rockmanorgames.com and get in stock games shipped ASAP and have them before the end of this campaign!

All retailers will be able to order at 50% OFF MSRP.  No Minimum Orders. Orders of 6+ will get free shipping (in most countries). Retailers will get everything before Distribution.

campaign.story:
You are CUTE, you are CUNNING, you are FIERCE … and it’s time to LEVEL UP!
THE MAGICAL KITTIES LEVEL UP! CAMPAIGN INCLUDES:
🐾 A reprint of the Deluxe Edition of Magical Kitties Save the Day!
⚡ The new Power Up! sourcebook featuring more powers & epic-level adventures! 
👑 Fantastica, a new hometown filled with fairytales and magic!
🏠 Series Workbook Pack, including the new Our Hometown Workbook and four My Kitty Workbooks to bring your story to life! 
MAGICAL KITTIES DELUXE EDITION AT A GLANCE:
⭐ You are magical kitties. You have humans. The humans have problems. Use your magical powers to solve their problems and save the day!
⭐ A roleplaying game designed for all ages to enjoy, that excels as an introduction to the hobby.
⭐ The elegantly simple rules system puts the emphasis on storytelling and supports a setting and characters that players are familiar with and love from the start.
Every Magical Kitty has a human. Every human has a Problem. In Magical Kitties Save the Day, you need to use your magical powers to solve problems and save the day. But kitties live in Hometowns that are filled with witches, aliens, hyper-intelligent raccoons, and other foes. They make human problems worse, so the kitties need to go on adventures to stop them before that can happen.
The Deluxe Edition of Magical Kitties Save the Day SOLD OUT just a few months after its original Kickstarter. Now we’re bringing it back as a special release not available via distribution. It’s packed full of high-quality component upgrades like wooden tokens and custom dice, and a bunch of bonus content including the Magical Power, Talent, and Flaw cards, and two extra Hometowns with maps.
But don’t worry if you’re missing a few Magical Kitties books for the Standard Edition you already bought. We’ve made them all available as add-ons for this campaign so you can easily complete your collection!
If you’ve been looking for a way to introduce your friends and family to roleplaying games, Magical Kitties is the perfect game to do it!
When you open the box, sitting right on top is Magical Kitties & The Big Adventure, a solo-play graphic novel adventure. This action-packed comic book is also a full scenario! Within moments, you’ll be able to create your magical kitty and go on an amazing adventure that will also teach you how to play the game.
After that, older players can be the game master for kids as young as six years old (and everyone else who loves kitties). And it's an excellent game for kids to start running on their own. Even if you’ve never played a roleplaying game, Magical Kitties includes the tools and guidance for both first-time roleplayers and first-time GMs.
Whether you’ve played board games with roleplaying elements, watched actual play videos, or just think roleplaying games sound like a lot of fun and you want to give them a try, Magical Kitties can be your first step into a larger world of fun.
In Magical Kitties Save the Day, one player — known as the game master (GM) — has a very special role. They describe the world in which the magical kitties live to the other players and, when the kitties take action, they use the rules of the game to figure out what happens next.
Playing Magical Kitties is easy. You have 3 Attributes – Cute, Cunning, and Fierce. You also have a Talent, a Flaw, and a Magical Power. When your kitty is trying to do something difficult, you’ll build a pool of six-sided dice with:
⭐ A number of dice equal to the attribute you’re using (Cute, Cunning, or Fierce)
⭐ An extra die if you’re using your Talent
⭐ Two extra dice if you’re using your Power
The game master sets a difficulty (a number from 3 to 6) and then you roll your dice pool. Each die that rolls equal to or higher than the difficulty is a success. The number of successes you rolled determines the outcome:
In Magical Kitties Save the Day, it’s not just a question of whether or not you succeed: It’s about how you succeed. The complications and bonuses generated by most outcomes drive the action forward in unexpected and exciting ways. You and your friends will discover the story together!

OTHER FUN GAMEPLAY ELEMENTS:
⭐ Character generation takes just 5 minutes.
⭐ The dice are always in the players' hands, not the GM's.
⭐ Players get Kitty Treats that let them change the story. You earn Kitty Treats by roleplaying your Flaw.
⭐ No one ever dies in Magical Kitties. If you take too many Owies, you get knocked out or otherwise “incapacitated” for the scene.
⭐ You get XP every time you fail a roll. And for saving the day, of course!

POWER UP! SOURCEBOOK AT A GLANCE:
⭐ 36 all-new powers for your magical kitties!
⭐ Epic foes, epic powers, and epic stunts for taking your game to the next level!
⭐ Guidelines for designing your own powers, bonus features, and more.
Original Magical Kitties creator Matthew J. Hanson returns to help you take your series to places you never imagined! Are you ready to confront the Mecha-Raccoon? Journey to alien planets? Leap through time? Confront the dark truths of your secret origin? Then you’re ready to power up!
Magical Kitties Power Up! also includes new rules for any series, including thirty-six brand new powers plus new bonus features for the powers you already love. Here are the rules for kitties who can control shadows, create magical art, or eat anything.

FANTASTICA HOMETOWN AT A GLANCE:
⭐ A brand new hometown to launch your new series, or to create a fairytale land any kitties can visit!
⭐ In this hometown, the magical kitties don’t have to hide their powers while they’re helping to solve Princess Problems.
⭐ The new castle-sitting, royal pains, and magical quest adventure recipes unlock all-new stories for any Magical Kitties series.
Welcome to Fantastica, a land created as a sanctuary for all that is magical. Here are the mythical creatures, towering castles, enchanted treasures, and feuding royal families of your dreams!
But not all is well in the land of Happily Ever After: Queen Carnelia, the ruler of a land greatly harmed by magic, believes that Fantastica must be destroyed! She has made it her mission to eradicate every last bit of magic that can be found, and her magic hunters prowl the kingdom in secret, disguised as knights, nobility, merchants, adventurers, and even occasionally princesses. If the magical kitties can’t stop them, they will corrupt the source of all magic! Their work has already begun, and monsters and curses plague the kingdoms of Fantastica.

Each Series Workbook Pack includes:
⭐ One (1)Our Hometown Workbook for your GM (24 pages)
⭐ Four (4) My Kitty Workbooks for your players (20 pages each)
Each is a full color, journal-sized booklet featuring iconic art from Magical Kitties Save the Day! They're everything you need to start sharing your own stories.
OUR HOMETOWN WORKBOOK AT A GLANCE:
⭐A beautiful, full-color workbook with everything a game master needs to create and run your Magical Kitties series!
⭐ Record your hometown map, locations, supporting cast, foes, disasters, and adventures. Keep a journal of your episodes and track your kitty krew's progress.
⭐ It's the perfect gift for a first-time game master, making running your first campaign as easy as turning the page!
MY KITTY WORKBOOKS AT A GLANCE:
⭐ Make your kitty immortal with this amazing, full-color record of all your adventures!
⭐ With four My Kitty Workbooks in each Series Workbook Pack, each player can keep their own notes on their hometown, human, house, and kitty krew.
⭐ Functions as a deluxe character sheet, and includes a cheat sheet so the rules are always at the tip of your claw!
DIGITAL FREEBIES PACK INCLUDES THESE PDFs/DIGTIAL FILES:
Form-Fillable Character Sheet, Printable Kitty Treat Tokens, Magical Kitties Coloring Sheets, Magical Kitties Wallpapers, Magical Kitties 20-Min Demo, GM Adventure Reference: Rules, GM Adventure Reference: Tables, River City Map, River City Library Map, Wild Ones Map, Alien Invasion Map, Happy Glade Map, Alien Invasion Tracker Sheet, Mars Colony Map
MAGICAL KITTIES DELUXE INCLUDES:
Box with sleeve & insert tray, Rulebook, Character Sheets Pad, The Big Adventure comic, Custom Kitty Paw Dice, Wood Kitty Treat Tokens, River City, River City Map, Alien Invasion, Alien Invasion Map, Wild Ones, Wild Ones Map, Kitty Cards
MAGICAL KITTIES DIGITAL INCLUDES THESE PDFs/DIGITAL FILES:
Rulebook PDF, Form-Fillable Character Sheet PDF, The Big Adventure comic PDF, River City PDF, River City Map
OTHER NOTES:
A delivery charge of shipping and estimated taxes will be added in Kickstarter’s checkout.
All pledge levels receive a discount on the entire Magical Kitties line of products to complete your collection.
If you haven't gotten us the info to fulfill your order within 1 year after we start fulfilling, we will convert your pledge into a tip/gift. 

Share this campaign with your friends and spread the word to unlock stretch goals!

✔️ $10,000: KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN FUNDING
Your pledge will help bring this project to life! Thank you for your support!
✔️ 250 BACKERS: OUR HOMETOWN WORKBOOK AS FORM-FILLABLE PDF
We'll take Our Hometown Workbook and upgrade its PDF to being form-fillable, to make it easier to share with your kitty krew or play Magical Kitties Save the Day online!
✔️ 500 BACKERS: MY KITTY WORKBOOK AS FORM-FILLABLE PDF
We'll convert My Kitty Workbook into a form-fillable PDF, too, so each player can fill in their own kitty's info virtually.
✔️ 750 BACKERS: POSTER MAP FOR THE FANTASTICA HOMETOWN 
Artist Brian Patterson returns with another exceptional poster map showing all the realms in the new Fantastica fairytale hometown:
⭐ The Kingdom of Mirrors is known for its magical fruit and Snow White’s fortress.
⭐ Yuki-onna’s castle is near the Frozen Mountain in the Kingdom of Frost. 
⭐ Mermaids and pirates both roam the waters of the Kingdom of Salt. 
⭐ In the Kingdom of Fairies, the Hollow Hills loom over Briar Rose’s castle.
⭐ Anansi keeps watch over the endless Library of Stories in the Kingdom of Webs. 
⭐ Climb the giant’s beanstalk from the Kingdom of Whiskers. 
⭐ The Kingdom of Towers is still home to Rapunzel.
⭐ Steal the firebird’s feathers from its nest in the Kingdom of Dolls. 
Note: Digital file for digital-only backers, digital + physical for other consumer tiers.
✔️ 1,000 BACKERS: TABLETOP SIMULATOR BUILDS FOR MAGICAL KITTIES
Tabletop Simulator is the popular player-driven physics sandbox for tabletop games on STEAM. With its interactive 3D visual space, it’s perfect for introducing younger gamers to online gaming, without the complicated forms and tables some online platforms use. 
We’ll release virtual tabletop builds for River City, Alien Invasion, Wild Ones, and Mars Colony to get you started.You’ll be able to move virtual miniatures of your kitties on the hometown map, pass out kitty treat tokens, and roll custom dice, all subject to a physics simulation. With Tabletop Simulator you can play Magical Kitties Save the Day with up to 10 friends online!
✔️ 1,250 BACKERS: DIY COLOR-AND-COOK MAGICAL KITTY MINIS
All backers get this meow-velous digital kit that details how to make your own Magical Kitties minis! You’ll get a PDF package that includes easy instructions and printables for creating color-and-cook minis featuring your kitty krew’s custom portraits.
✔️ 1,500 BACKERS: DIY COLOR-AND-COOK MAGICAL KITTY MINIS SET TWO
We’ll add a template sheet of 10 blank portrait frames to the Magical Kitties Minis PDF kit. Because yes, we love magical kitties, but what about everyone else the kitties meet? Draw your own critters, thingamajigs, aliens, and all the rest!
1,750 BACKERS: MAGICAL KITTY MINIS BIG BORDERS
We’ll include a PDF template sheet of Magical Kitties Minis blank borders with 4 big portrait frames and 3 standard ones.
How does it work? 
Just buy a pack of the special shrinkable plastic sheets, and print the included PDF template on them. The template includes 10 portrait borders plus kitty art from Magical Kitties Save the Day converted to outlines. Color your kitties’ pictures with markers, cut them out, and heat them in the oven. The plastic will shrink down to a third its original size, while getting 9x thicker.
In just a few minutes you’ll have your own kitty krew tokens to mark your spot on your hometown map! For stand-up figures, place one in the slot of a plastic minis base, apply a dab of hot glue on the bottom to secure it, and you’re ready to play Magical Kitties Save the Day in 3D! And you can even use the extra plastic sheet bits to make custom Kitty Treats, or whatever other extras you can imagine.
More stretch goals will be revealed throughout the campaign. 

❌ THERE’S NO PLEDGE MANAGER FOR THIS CAMPAIGN: Be sure to pick up all your add-ons NOW either in Kickstarter’s checkout or on our web store.
🎁 BUY ADD-ONS ON KICKSTARTER: This campaign’s add-ons page in Kickstarter’s checkout will let you pick up the things you missed, hassle free. If you buy add-ons on Kickstarter, they'll ship together with the campaign's new releases in November.
📦 DON'T WANT TO WAIT? USE THE WEB STORE SPECIAL: If you don't want to wait for products that are available today, visit our web store after backing your tier on Kickstarter. Just use the backer-only checkout code posted in Kickstarter Update #1 to get your discount on Magical Kitties items on our site. Products ordered via our web store ship immediately!
SOURCEBOOKS:  Work on Power Up! and Fantastica are also well underway, with manuscripts written and art nearly complete.
WORKBOOKS: The two workbooks in the Series Workbook Pack are complete. The art and layout are finished, and they’re ready for press.
Our updates to backers will feature this handy chart to keep you informed on our progress at every step along the way:
Shipping is paid on checkout. Kickstarter will calculate the delivery cost for your destination country when you back the project.
The delivery charge includes our estimation of applicable duty and taxes (VAT/GST) for Canada, the EU, Norway, Switzerland and the UK. We use “Delivery Duty Paid” (DDP) so that customs duties, fees and taxes are charged back to us.
In other countries you may be required to pay duties, taxes, and a handling fee upon delivery of your rewards. We work to minimize such charges, but every country and courier has its own regulations, rates, practices, and policies.
We ship your rewards ourselves. Rewards will ship from the Atlas Games warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota, USA. Based on our experience, this is more reliable and ultimately less expensive than a collection of global fulfillment warehouses. In part due to our direct control of this facility, our shipping operations have remained both open and safe during the global pandemic.
Retailers get their usual terms. Retail tier backers pay shipping later, if at all, using Atlas Games’ standard direct-to-retail sales terms for shipping. See “Retailers,” below.

We believe that healthy retailers are key to a healthy hobby. We have a reputation for taking care of our retailer partners, and our Kickstarter campaigns are no exception. 
THIS CAMPAIGN IS RETAIL-FRIENDLY BECAUSE:
⭐ You pay what you expect, at our standard retailer discount (50%) and regular shipping terms.
⭐ Exclusive access to the DELUXE reprint of the Magical Kitties boxed set, which will not be made available through distribution.
⭐ Retail-only stretch goal. If 100 retail stores back this campaign, each one will receive a free demo copy of the Magical Kitties Save the Day STANDARD boxed set. (As a point of reference, 168 retailers backed our last campaign!)
⭐ Personal attention for ordering. Our salesperson will contact you to take your order, so no need to worry about ordering add-ons now in Kickstarter.
⭐ Immediate sales. Retailer backers may sell products from this Kickstarter as soon as they receive their orders.
⭐ Magical Kitties is a family favorite. The first print run sold out in just a few months, making it a proven winner for your store!
Questions? Asks us directly at sales@atlas-games.com!

Matthew is the creator of Magical Kitties Save the Day, and author of Alien Invasion and Power Up! He’s written RPG material for Kobold Press, Green Ronin Publishing, Dragon and Dungeon Magazines, EN Publishing, Expeditious Retreat Press, and more. He also runs Sneak Attack Press, which produced the silver ENnie Award-winning Broken Earth setting and the original RPG Abstract Dungeon. He lives in Minneapolis with his wife, two cats, and young son. His son's first word was, in fact, "kitty."
Clio is a game designer and writer who creates LARPs, tabletop roleplaying games, interactive fiction games, and card games. Their freeform game The Long Drive Back from Busan won the Golden Cobra Challenge award for Best Game That Incorporates Meaningful, Non-Romantic Relationships in 2017, and Clio’s game about the future of ancestor worship, The Truth About Eternity, was presented at Fastaval 2019 in Denmark. They wrote Mars Colony and the new Fantastica hometown for Magical Kitties Save the Day. Visit Clio online.
Ekaterina is mostly known as Pinguinlog. She’s been drawing since childhood and professionally for the past six+ years. She says, “Mostly I’m interested in drawing nature and animals. I think we can learn a lot from the world around us, so I like to explore it from different angles.” She’s also the happy owner of a Caique parrot, Arthur, and two precious cats, Kitty and Sassy, who give her constant inspiration and good reference for Magical Kitties Save the Day.
Anthony’s excellent work was spotlighted in the Kitty Cards set for Magical Kitties Save the Day, and throughout the Rulebook and hometowns. He previously illustrated the Raid & Trade board game. He can be found on Instagram as @sorrow_scavenger
Brian is the creator of gaming webcomic d20Monkey. He’s also the artist behind the detailed hometown maps in Alien Invasion and Wild Ones for Magical Kitties Save the Day. For this Kickstarter campaign, he does his artistic magic again for the new poster map of Fantastica’s realms.
Michelle is co-owner and Chief Creative Officer of Atlas Games. She's also Magical Kitties Save the Day’s biggest fan. No doubt that’s why she saved the graphic design for Our Hometown Workbook and My Kitty Workbook for herself. She knew she’d be using them a LOT and wanted to make them purr-fect!
Justin is the RPG Producer at Atlas Games, responsible for the ongoing development of award-winning games like Feng Shui, Over the Edge, Unknown Armies, and Ars Magica. He’s also the co-designer of the Infinity Roleplaying Game and the creator of the Alexandrian, which won a 2019 ENnie Award.
As well as being our freelance crowdfunding consultant, Heather is the managing director of UNPUB and a lead member of the Game Maker’s Guild of Philadelphia. She’s also the CEO of 9th Level Games, a small tabletop publisher of board game and roleplaying games. Heather’s notable published games include Meeple Party, Schrodinger’s Cats, and Pavlov’s Dogs.
After an 11-year military career, Travis joined Atlas Games initially as Warehouse Manager, but found his love for travel and meeting new folks irresistible, and so switched to conventions and sales. You’ll find him at all the big shows, but when he’s home he loves working with retailers. He also does his best to spend time painting minis every day. His Plague Bearers were called out by one miniatures contest judge as “almost smellable.” Travis also works part time at Tower Games in Minneapolis.
The man who makes the magic happen in the warehouse, Woody has decades of experience in the industry with companies like Steve Jackson Games, Lion Rampant, and his own Tundra Sales Org. He works safely and separately to flatten the curve, making sure our warehouse stays open and your order will be shipped normally, come what may.
Visit our website at atlas-games.com!

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Magical Kitties Save the Day is designed to be an heirloom game: You’ll be playing it with your kids today; your kids will be playing it with their kids tomorrow. We’re using tested, high-quality components and including digital resources to ensure you’ll alway be able to make your kitties magical.
Reusability and recyclability
Key components like dice and tokens are being over-produced so that you can expand your game or replace damaged components without needing to buy a new copy.
Sustainable materials
We don't use shrink-wrap if we can help it. Individual card decks are either banded with a paper band or held together with its box. Game boxes are kept closed with a small sticker. Our tokens use either wooden components or chipboard to avoid plastic waste.

Shipping will be charged after the campaign ends through CrowdOx pledge manager.
For this campaign, we will offer friendly shipping to the USA, UK, Europe, Canada, China and Australia.  We will send games to our partner warehouses in these regions in order to keep the shipping costs as low as possible for you. This also means that we will cover the cost of import duties and custom fees to these regions ourselves, so you don’t have to.

VAT
The EU has recently implemented stricter tax regulations on online sales in general and crowdfunding in particular. We thus are obliged to collect and pay VAT on the value of the total of the pledge and shipping amount according to the VAT rates of each respective country.  VAT will be charged in the pledge manager.
It is important to note that VAT is a sales tax that is separate from import taxes or duties. We will cover import duties in the USA, Europe, UK, Canada, China and Australia so you do not have to worry about those. Other regions will probably incur import duties.
Mighty Boards aims to create immersive board game experiences with gorgeous game design, intense challenges and evocative stories. We believe that a game depends on its rules, stories and the visuals and pieces that express them. While our games span a variety of thematic and mechanical genres, they have one thing in common, which we like to think of as something of a mission statement: the tight coupling of rich,  evocative theme and meaty, engaging mechanics.
Our talented team, based in Malta, places great importance on these innovative mechanics that stimulate the imagination. Every product goes through rigorous development and a solid testing process to make sure we deliver only top-quality products. At Mighty Boards, we go all in to bring you a great gaming experience.

Terms and Conditions
When you pledge for our games you are agreeing to the following terms and conditions:
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVITY:  Kickstarter Exclusive items like the Overkill Promo Pack will not enter regular distribution. However, they will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Mighty Boards on our website.
REFUND POLICY Mighty Boards follows the standard Kickstarter terms for refund. This means that we will provide a full refund if the request is received within 14 days from the end of the campaign. Any request made after this period will be at the discretion of Mighty Boards and will be a maximum of 90% of the pledge cost due to Kickstarter and card fees already paid by Mighty Boards.
RETURNING PRODUCTS If you fail to accept your package when it is delivered we will not issue a refund for the cost of the pledge.
DAMAGED PRODUCTS  We guarantee that the packages you receive from us will be complete and include all the items in perfect condition. We will replace any missing or damaged items. In the case of minor cosmetic damage to external boxes replacement will be decided on a case by case basis.
SURVEY RESPONSE  We use CrowdOx as a pledge manager. You will be required to fill a survey on that platform. We will send out several emails and updates notifying you of the deadline to fill the survey. If you do not fill out the survey by this deadline after notifications have been sent, we may not be able to send you your pledge.
REASONABLE CHANGES TO PRODUCT We will keep testing and developing the game until it’s as close to perfect as possible. Due to this and potential improvements suggested by the factory the final product may be different from the prototype shown on this page. By pledging to this project you acknowledge that the final game may be different from that presented in this Kickstarter campaign. Having said this, Mighty Boards will make every effort to keep the final game as close to the Kickstarter project as possible and only make changes to improve the game. Mighty Boards will also inform backers of the major changes and reasons for such changes.

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter has now ended but if you missed out - or want more episodes - visit our website:  https://thedetectivesociety.com/
 We deliver a package to your door every month, filled to the brim with incredible puzzles and an exciting, intricate plot. 
You can play by yourself, with your partner or with a team of your friends or colleagues.
The Cursed Exhibition will deliver a deep, immersive and narrative-driven world for you to explore, all from the comfort of your own home.
We put your detective skills to the test: you need to piece together the evidence and make deductions in order to solve the case.
But you don’t just interact with the physical items in the package - a complex digital world sprawls out in front of you, requiring you to investigate the lives of the characters and interact with them via email, chatbots and SMS/Whatsapp.
Think of it as a true crime show meets an escape room meets the internet.
We're looking for intelligent new recruits — and we mean intelligent. We won't lie; our missions are no walk in the park.
Read on to see if you've got what it takes.
 Receive a package to your door! Our packages are delivered direct to you, filled with incredible puzzles and a deep, immersive world.
 Team up or play alone! You can play by yourself, with your partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues. Each of the packages should last between 90 and 120 minutes.
 Interact with the world! Contact the characters by email or Whatsapp, hack into their online banking, or research website content to help solve the puzzles.
 Become immersed in the story! Put yourself into the shoes of the detective to solve The Cursed Exhibition.
 Continue your journey! Each package follows on from the previous one, presenting you with new challenges and exciting plot twists.
Physical Items
At the heart of each episode is the package that will be delivered through your door. Inside you will find a range of different items, which you will need to solve the case. 
Interactive Technology
To create a truly modern detective experience, all members of the Society will need to examine digital sources as well as the physical ones in the package.
Our bespoke communication systems allow players to converse with characters via email and SMS/Whatsapp.
Our detailed and immersive websites create complex online worlds for detectives to explore as they search for answers.
Exhaustive Clue System
Even the best detectives can require a little help. That's why we've created an innovative and exhaustive clue system to enable detectives to get a little assistance should they require it.
Our master detective Lucid Montgomery takes a look over every case that comes through our door and is kind enough to write down a few prompts for each part of each episode in case a detective is in need of assistance.
Welcoming Community
We have already collected together an incredible bunch of detectives on our dedicated Facebook and Reddit groups.
These amazing detectives discuss and share their findings, assisting each other when they get stuck and pointing out hidden tidbits that some might have missed (while flagging spoilers, of course).
We know some detectives like to work alone, but for those that don't, you will find the community a welcoming place for you to discuss the cases.
We won "Best Mystery Game" in the 2020 Bullseye Awards
We need your help Detectives!
We have to find out more about what is happening at the museum.
It's a matter of life and death.
------------------------------
We're delighted to bring all of our backers three exclusive puzzles over the course of the Kickstarter campaign.
These mini-puzzles will reveal more about the mission ahead and reveal a horrifying secret about the museum and the dangers that lie in wait.
To take part, make sure you've pledged and are keeping an eye on our Kickstarter updates. 
All three parts are now live.
We hope you enjoy.
We are very excited to be able to offer you the chance to add-on our existing adventures to your pledge, and get them at a discounted price.
The Disappearance of Claire Makova - when the daughter of a high-profile diplomat goes missing, you are hired to track her down before its too late.
The Sudden Silence of Timothy Lee - a young man falls into an inexplicable coma, can you unravel the mysterious secrets behind his illness?
The add-ons will be shipped in July 2021, alongside Episode One of The Cursed Exhibition.
So what made us decide to launch The Cursed Exhibition on Kickstarter?
Kickstarter is a hugely helpful way for us to plan for the costs of producing our games and the complex logistics involved in putting them together.
By pre-selling on Kickstarter, we know how ambitious we can be with our plans for The Cursed Exhibition. The huge support we received for The Disappearance of Claire Makova and The Sudden Silence of Timothy Lee meant we could do so much more than we originally planned.
Every copy that's purchased on Kickstarter contributes to extra design features, video work, voiceovers, interactive elements, digital content and physical box contents. Simply put, the more you support us the more we'll be able to do.
We're a small company, but we have big ideas and your support makes them a reality.
We are pleased to say that we ship worldwide! You can view the shipping costs in the table below:
We do not charge the full shipping fee to our customers. We absorb some of the cost ourselves.
Taxes and Duties
UK
All of our games are manufactured and shipped from the UK and so we are able to guarantee tax-free delivery.
European Union
Following Brexit, we are continuing to work hard to find a reliable, monthly, duty-free method of delivery to our EU customers. We are hopeful that we will have this fully in place by the time we start shipping The Cursed Exhibition. 
However, if we are unable to do this then we will again give all backers the option to receive all six games in one package, delivered duty-free, which will be shipped after the final episode of the season has been released. 
USA, Canada & The Rest of the World
We take all precautions to ensure that customers outside of the UK and EU pay no customs or import fees - including attaching CN22 forms - although we cannot guarantee your parcel will not be held at customs or have additional fees applied. 
If you have had board games sent to you in the past from the UK without issues, then there is a good chance the same will happen with The Detective Society's games.
The Cursed Exhibition is made up of six episodes and if you buy the whole season you will receive one per month. We'll ship each of the episodes to all players simultaneously. This will help avoid any spoilers, whilst also giving all players the chance, if they wish, to experience each episode at the same time as every other player, making it an exciting 'live' event.
Do you need to have played previous The Detective Society games to play The Cursed Exhibition?
Absolutely not! This is a brand new, six-episode standalone adventure that requires no previous knowledge of our old cases.
How do the pledge levels work?
If you pledge for “First Package” then you will receive your package shipped at the same time as everybody else, at the end of July 2021. You can then choose to buy the rest of the season, either via a subscription or by buying the packages individually when they are released.
If you pledge for “All Six Packages” then you are purchasing the whole adventure; you will receive one episode every month. The story will run alongside your life for the entire six months!
Any add-ons you purchase will be shipped at the same time as the first episode of The Cursed Exhibition.
Who can play the game?
The game can be played solo, with a partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues and is recommended for players aged over 14 years, due to the peril the characters find themselves faced with.
When will we deliver?
Episode One will be produced and shipped in late July 2021, with the subsequent five episodes being shipped monthly from then on.
It's always been important to us that we deliver what we promise on schedule, and we have achieved that with our two previous Kickstarters.
All our processes and supply chains have been established from the production of The Disappearance of Claire Makova and The Sudden Silence of Timothy Lee and that will continue seamlessly as we move into the production of The Cursed Exhibition.
What if I already have a subscription to the Society?
Firstly; thank you for supporting us! If you already have a subscription with The Detective Society, you do not need to pledge on Kickstarter to receive The Cursed Exhibition. It will automatically be delivered to you as part of your monthly schedule.
The Cursed Exhibition is being designed by the same people that brought you the previous Detective Society games - Joe Mills and Tristan Rogers - while Dan Wiseman is in charge of the business operations.
Before creating The Detective Society, Joe was instrumental in the success of some of the best escape games that London has to offer. His journey began with Time Run, ('fifth best escape room company in the world' in 2018); before moving onto Sherlock: The Game Is Now - the official BBC TV series tie-in. He also created and launched one of Design My Night's top picks for a night out in London: the immersive puzzle-based cocktail experience, The Case of the Poisoned Chalice. Joe takes the lead when it comes to creating all the puzzles.
Tristan is a game designer, actor and award-winning writer. He's worked in some of London's top theatres and has written on numerous programmes for BBC Radio. He’s worked with Joe designing puzzles at various escape games, most recently penning the plot for The Case of The Poisoned Chalice. Tristan is in charge of overseeing the narrative of the cases.
Dan is our managing director and brings his vast business and marketing experience to the team. For over 10 years he has been building and operating successful businesses, including a digital marketing agency. He is connected to the The Detective Society through a mutual love of all things gaming-related, evidenced by his constant stream of RPG game ideas. Dan made his first RPG when he was just 13 years old. Dan ensures that we deliver on our promises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project, there are of course various risks and challenges involved - problems with design, procurement and shipping can all occur. However, our extensive work creating our previous two seasons means we have lots of experience to draw on. We have established good relationships with our key suppliers, and we are now very well versed in the processes required to release one episode a month. Our budgets are thorough, and we have built in significant contingency to deal with those issues we cannot foresee.

Of course there is one major factor which is outside of our control. Covid-19 continues to spread across the world, and its existence has underpinned the lifespan of our young company. As we have existed with it for so long, we are confident we can deal with what the current situation throws at us. We are in regular contact with our suppliers, all of whom continue to operate as normal. Initially it impacted on the delivery timescales of our suppliers, but - at present - those have returned to their normal estimated delivery times. However, things can change quickly and disruption to our supply and distribution networks (both here in the UK and worldwide) may impact our ability to deliver according to our planned schedule.

Something else
We manufacture in the UK, which is also where the vast majority of our suppliers are based, reducing our carbon footprint.

campaign.story:
Nowhereville is a horror-themed tabletop roleplaying game set in a town that won't let you leave. Terrible things happen in Nowhereville, perpetrated both by monstrous people and literal monsters. But the townsfolk constantly forget about these things. For some reason, you remember. And you fight back. 
The game draws inspiration from the early works of Stephen King, the X-Files, and Twin Peaks. 
In Nowhereville, you'll endeavor to stop terrible things, defeat monsters, save lives, and foil plots. And maybe, just maybe, someday you'll get to leave. 
Complete, all-in-one rulebook for players and GMs
Character creation in 5 minutes
Play six different archetypes with templates available for adding supernatural capabilities to your character
GM advice and guidelines for this type of game
A complete town with map, overview, organizations, NPCs, monsters, personal secrets, and other details
Intensity dial to adjust how your game plays
Characters have four Traits (Body, Mind, Charm, and Heart), each rated 1-4. When determining whether you succeed on a task that has consequences for failure, you'll roll a number of six-sided dice equal to the rating of the Trait being used versus a target number between 4 and 6. Every time you make a Trait check, besides determining success or failure, you'll earn a point in one of three tracks (Skill, Spirit, or Sway).
You spend Skill to advance your character. Spirit is spent to gain in-game advantages. Sway describes the influence the town has on you, and eventually punishes you for daring to fight back. 
Your character also has access to a variety of talents, powers, and templates that you can use to customize them. 
In addition to the game book,  you'll receive the following support materials. 
 Character Playbook and Template PDFs - Form-fillable PDF character playbook for every character type in the game as well as every template available in the game
This Kickstarter is lean and mean. 
The game is fully designed, playtested, and edited, and currently in layout. Artwork is finished. Your pledge will go toward reimbursing the expenses previously incurred and covering remaining expenses. 
There are no stretch goals. There are no special backer level to create something to be added to the book later. Nothing to slow us down in getting the game to you. 
The Kickstarter will fulfill as quickly as we can wrap up the layout and get proof copies approved. 
PDFs will be fulfilled with DriveThruRPG.com. You'll receive a download link when the game is ready. 
You'll receive a link that will allow you purchase a copy of the physical book at-cost. You'll pay shipping then. 
The at-cost price is just what it takes to print the book, so it's super-cheap!
The cost may change a bit based on final page count. The following costs are approximate. 
$3.50 USD for a softcover
$8.00 USD for a hardcover
Shipping varies based on your location, but shipping to a US location runs around $5 USD. Go HERE to see estimates for shipping to countries outside the US. Assume a page count of around 120. 
DriveThruRPG's shipping services don't include VAT or tax for Canada, Australia, or the European Union.
PDF download links for add-ons will be sent out a few weeks after the campaign ends, as soon as we've collected backer surveys from everyone. 
 Game Design, Illustrations, and Layout: Craig Campbell (he/him) is an architect, horror fan, indie RPG designer, and the owner of NerdBurger Games. He is the designer of the award-winning CAPERS RPG, as well as several others. He has freelanced for a variety of other RPGs, enjoys exploring worlds not often explored in RPGs, and is a firm believer in the idea that there is no such thing as "too many games."
 Editing: Ginny Loveday (she/her) is a best-selling D&D designer and editor in addition to being the host of the Designer's Den TTRPG interview show on Twitch, and co-host of the DnD Roundtable podcast with Paige Leitman. Find out more at http://ginnyloveday.com.
 Cartography: Ryan Hennesy (he/him) is the founder of Whipstache Designs and has been doing cartography, illustrations, and graphic and web design in TTRPGs for four years (and for many more years than that outside roleplaying games). You can find his work at https://whipstache.com/ or connect with him on twitter (@whipstache).
