updates.update_content:
Greetings, residents…
Just a quick reminder about two things.
Backer Surveys

Greetings, residents…
Just shy of 600 backers! Wow!!
The Nowhereville Kickstarter is over. Thank you so much for helping make the game a reality. We hope you enjoy exploring this nasty, little town as much as we enjoyed creating it.
Backer Surveys

Greetings, residents…
The town and its evils are never-ending. It’ll take all sorts of people fighting back, young and old, to defeat it.
Here we are. The final few days. Once again, thanks so much for getting us this far! You’re the best.

Greetings, residents…
Luna plunged the stake into the vampire’s heart, killing the last one remaining in town. It had to be done, but she also knew that the town would punish her for it. It had been too long since her actions had cost her something important.
About a week to go and still rocking along. As always, the middle of the Kickstarter is kind of slow, so here’s another look at what’s to come.
The Sway Track

Greetings, residents…
Junkyard owner Ike Dodd is chatting with butcher Natalie Splint, as she cuts up some chops for him. He’s a secret moonshiner and she harbors a taste for human flesh. Wait, I might have that mixed up. He’s able to curse people and she’s secretly obsessed with raising the dead. Or maybe…

Greetings, residents…
In Nowhereville, things aren’t always as they seem. Sometimes what you THINK is a monster with fangs and claws is actually a monstrous person with a horrific agenda and a willingness to do harm.
Here we are in the doldrums of the Kickstarter mid-run. Things slow down. So now is a perfect time to take a minute or two and share the campaign on your social media. Any aid you can render in spreading the word about Nowhereville is greatly appreciated.

Greetings, residents…
After staking the vampire old man Willis and dealing with a bunch of bogeys threatening to abduct the town’s children, the heroes of Nowhereville finally have a chance to catch their collective breath. And maybe make a big change in the town. What will they do?
We hit 300 backers today, just a little over a week in. That’s pretty cool. Welcome aboard to all the new backers and thank you to everyone for helping us hit 300.

Greetings, residents…
Heroes don’t have an easy time in Nowhereville. The more good you do, the more you prove yourself a threat to the forces that envelope the town, the more likely you are to be punished.
Here we are, closing in on 300 backers. Maybe we’ll get there by the one week point. Fingers crossed. I’ll be dividing deep into layout this weekend and will have glimpses of the actual book laid out in the future. But for today, I thought I’d show you a part of the mechanics that is integral to the Roll-Track system and Nowhereville.

Greetings, residents…
In a strange turn of events, the residents of Nowhereville rose up to square off against the looming beast.
I’ll be honest. I’m surprised at the turnout on day one of this Kickstarter. I was hoping for 300 or so backers for the campaign. Seemed like a nice number. I’d consider that a success.

campaign.story:
Is your bookshelf a mess? Do you own so many games they’ve become a hazard? Are your dungeon crawls a disorganized disaster? We were like that, too – so we came up with a solution!
This Kickstarter funds a custom-printed shelf file designed for holding adventure modules, hardcover RPG books, and boxed sets. All four exterior panels feature new hand-painted art by Doug Kovacs!
The shelf file has a 3” wide spine. This is thick enough to fit two big hardbacks, about 25 “skinny modules,” or one to two RPG boxed sets. It also fits board games that are in letter-sized dimensions. It comes with preprinted spine labels you can use to identify the contents.
We're offering backers of this Kickstarter a special pre-distribution price. When offered through distribution at a later date, we anticipate these costing $5 more.
With enough support, our stretch goals will give away extra shelf files to backers for free!
We're also offering a great price on a big collection of randomly selected adventure modules for your new shelf file!
And backers will get to vote on the final name of the product!
The Sturdy Shelf File
Made of durable corrugated cardboard, the shelf file is die-cut to shape. It ships flat, and easily folds into position. Each box is individually polybagged for safety in shipping.
The shelf file of holding, ready for your adventure modules!
Amazing Art
Doug Kovacs has hand-painted brand new art specially designed just for this project. He sketched out the image on a physical sample and painted it to fit. It will look so good, you’ll want to leave this shelf file out in the open!
Spine Labels
Each shelf file comes with a page of labels. You can use these to easily identify what’s in the box. 
Stretch Goals through Economies of Scale
We're already level 1! That means bonus shelf files!Read this update for details! Now, help us get to 6th level!
The printing for this project is a classic example of economies of scale. We need to produce a die-cut mold and cover a number of up-front costs. The more we print, the faster we hurdle those fixed costs, and the lower the unit cost becomes. Stretch goals are therefore based on backers getting more copies for the same price they already pledged. 
The basic pledge levels cover 1, 2, or 3 shelf files, and those pledge levels don’t receive stretch goals. If you pledge for 4, 6, 8, or 10 shelf files, those pledge levels will begin to receive extra copies if we hit certain milestones. The end result looks kind of like a class progression table. If you've played D&D you know what we mean! It works like this:
For example: if the project hits 4,000 shelf files sold, everyone who pledged for 4 shelf files will actually get 5; everyone who pledged for 6 will actually get 7; and so on.
Above 6,000 copies, the incremental unit costs don’t reduce appreciably. There are no more extra levels above there. (Unless we hit some crazy amount - never say never!)
Note that the bonus shelf files don’t “count double” – only the core pledged copies count toward the stretch goal math.
 Fill It With Adventures! 
Buy your shelf file pre-filled with adventure modules at a great price! 
For $75, you can add on a stack of 20 randomly selected adventures from our extensive line. You will save at least $125 price against cover price. There will be no duplication among the adventures, which will come from our Dungeon Crawl Classics, Mutant Crawl Classics, Fifth Edition Fantasy, Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar, and other product lines.
Depending on the mix of adventures in your random pull, you may save even more than $125. Most of our adventure modules are priced at $10, but some limited-edition variants have an MSRP of $15 or more. Those options will be included in the random pull, so depending on the mix of titles you receive, you may get an even better deal for the $75 add-on price.
Each shelf file holds about 25 adventure modules! Stuff it full with a random pull!
What To Name This Thing?
We asked our fans what to name this thing, and we had so many great suggestions! So many, in fact, that we could not decide.
Every day we will change the name of this project to a prospective name. Over the course of the project you will see two dozen possible names!
Once the project ends, all backers will be given a chance to vote.
May the best name win!
Shipping Costs
Based on the advance prototype, we can estimate shipping costs as follows. Please note that these are estimates. Final costs will be determined at time of shipping based on weight of the physical goods. These shipping costs are for the shelf file only and do not include the pack of randomly selected adventures. That pack will add approximately $10-$15 in additional shipping cost in the USA and substantially more for international orders. International shipping costs below include prepaid VAT and shipping via a very efficient FedEx program with prefilled customs forms and quick turnaround. US shipping is estimated via priority mail.
1 shelf file: $10-12 USA; $18-$20 international
2-3 shelf files: $12-13 USA; $25-$30 international
4-6 shelf files: $14-16 USA; $35-$45 international
8-10 shelf files: $17-18 USA; $50-$80 international
Tidy up your bookshelf with the Shelf File of Holding!

campaign.story:
This project will fund the production of Court of Blades, the tabletop roleplaying game of courtly drama, power politics, magic, peril and romance. Court of Blades takes place in the vibrant, fantasy renaissance city-state of Ilrien, in a world populated by scheming nobles, court magicians, and dashing duelists. 
As a noble retainer, you will engage in the polite civil warfare of the great families. You will host lavish balls, and manipulate the courts, uncover the plots of your rivals, protect the city from arcane dangers, manage your own intrigues and personal scandals, leverage your reputations, connections, and so much more.
Inspired by infamous warring families like history's Medicis and Pazzis, Shakespeare's Montagues and Capulets, or Game of Thrones' Starks and Lannisters, in Court of Blades you will take on the role of a talented retainer to a newly risen House of the Esultare in the great city of Ilrien. The Esultare, composed of the six Houses Major, are considered to be the most powerful families in the Principalities. Amongst them they have their own pecking order, and every citizen of Ilrien is aware of every house’s position within that order.
You’ve already risen so high, but to secure your place and ensure that the house you serve ascends to the highest seat of power in the Principalities, you will have to learn about your rival houses, advance your house’s agenda, and risk your lives in a world of duplicity and magic.
We play to find out if our noble retainers can play the Great Game and win it all, or if they'll fall prey to the machinations of their rivals or their own human failings.

Each game session of Court of Blades centers around one errand that your coterie has chosen to prioritize accomplishing on behalf of the house you serve. You will have time to complete three of these errands in each Social Season, tied to the calendar year in Ilrien. How much of your agenda you manage to successfully complete will determine your ability to advance the house at the end of each Social Season. Beware, the higher you climb, the more rivals you will find waiting for you.
5/17/21 Update: We had an amazing interview with Craig over at Third Floor Wars where we talked about developing Court of Blades, what a "Court of Thrones" expansion would look like, just how chonky this game really is and so much more! Click me!
 5/6/21 Update: As of today, we also have this amazing one-shot with the Don't Forget Your Towel Podcast group. You don't want to miss it! Click me!
Check out the Court of Blades Actual Play with Jamilia Nedjadi (they/them), Sean Nittner (he/him), Kristin Devine (she/her), Navi Drake (she/her), GMed by Shawn Drake (he/him), starting with character and coterie creation!
Court of Blades is built on the bones of John Harper's Forged in the Dark system. It is a fiction-first, d6 dice pool game that is easy to play and focuses on the action, while giving you all of the tools you need to tell incredible stories with mechanical support. Responsibility for shaping the story is shared equally amongst the group, and there is very little GM prep-work to be done before each game. 
It uses a core resolution mechanic that asks the players whether their current action is being done from a controlled, risky, or desperate position. Each situation will result in a number of different outcomes beyond mere success or failure. In Court of Blades, even a "bad roll" will change the landscape, affect the scene, and drive the story in interesting and satisfying directions. 
Here are some of the new toys we’ve added to help you tell these stories of intrigue and peril:
 A FitD Game built for campaign-length play. While you can absolutely run a one-shot, or a single Social Season; as lovers of long-running games, Court of Blades was built to run for 30+ sessions. Plenty of time to develop deep bonds with rivals and friends, change an entire city, and maybe even find true love as you claw your way to the top.
 New and easy-to-use GM’s tools that allow you to create a fully dynamic city that is filled with constantly evolving plots. With just a few dice rolls in-between each Social Season of the game, there will always be new secrets for the PCs to uncover.
 The “Uncover a Plot” mechanic to discover what your rival houses are secretly up to. And, of course, mechanics to foil their efforts and pave the way for your house’s ascension.
Way more “special permission” abilities and items than you can shake a narrative stick at.
 New mechanics for Scandals, Bonds, Romance and Paramours, Intrigues, Influence, Warring Houses and more. 
You can also hear us talking about some of the mechanical changes we made to the system while it was in development with the Hacked in the Dark podcast crew: Right Here!
In addition, we've put together a preview of the book's early release formatting that you can grab: Right Here!

The Playbooks you'll find inside.
Players will each choose one of our six core Playbooks to build their retainer, ranging from the political mastermind, to the powerful magician. Or change the game with one of our two “advanced” Playbooks, the Kiss and the Curse. One bound by fae blood, and the other by dark and forgotten magic.
Multiple players can choose the same playbook, but the team gets a better range of unique abilities when everyone chooses a different playbook as their core concept. You can always reach into other playbooks to mix and match special abilities later!
The Bravo is a dashing sworn-sword, quick of wit and unmatched in combat. The Bravo gains xp when they address a challenge with violence or panache.
The Hawk is a dangerous bounty hunter, menacing and unflappable in the face of danger. The Hawk gains xp when they address a challenge with pursuit or observation.
The Eye is a master agent and infiltrator, cannier than a skulk of foxes and just as hard to catch. The Eye gains xp when they address a challenge with stealth or perception.
The Couth is a street-wise wildcard, lucky or dangerous enough to rise from the gutter. The Couth gains xp when they address a challenge with evasion or mayhem.
The Knack is a magical expert, gifted with arcane power and knowledge of the hidden world. The Knack gains xp when they address challenges with arcane knowledge or power.
The Key is a political mastermind, able to craft arguments and devices with ease. The Key gains xp when they address challenges with expertise or calculation.
The Kiss is a fae-touched charmer and magical manipulator. The Kiss gains xp when they address challenges with fae power or control.
The Curse is a haunted revenant bearing ancient knowledge, weaponry, and a grudge. The Curse gains xp when they address challenges with callous disregard or unearthly endurance.
The Bravo's Playbook
The Houses who await your service.
Players decide, as a group, which of the six great houses they want their PCs to serve. Each house has its own set of strengths to explore, and its own unique flavor to inspire the sort of stories your group wants to tell. While any house can be played in whichever way the group wishes, you will find that each house lends itself naturally to a different style of play, right out of the box.
House Corvetto, the "Majestic Tyrants" lend themselves to games of mystery, manipulation, seduction and the arcane. Serving the Corvetto, your coterie marks xp when they overcome obstacles with Coercion or Majesty.
House Battalia, the "Old House of Martial Valor" lend themselves to games of thrilling feats of arms, protection of the city and courts, and upholding the law. In service to Battalia, your coterie marks xp when they overcome obstacles with Honor or Tradition.
House Bastien, the "Rising Tide" lend themselves to games of charity, revolution, and looking out for the little guy against all odds. When you pledge yourselves to Bastien, your coterie marks xp when they overcome obstacles with Audacity or Unorthodoxy.
House Lovell, the "Arcane Gossipmongers of Wealth and Taste" lend themselves to games of social intrigue, scandal, deadly rumors and arcane secrets. Under the auspices of the Lovell, your coterie marks xp when they overcome obstacles with Secrets or Discernment.
House Al-Mari, the "Tower Built of Spit and Spite" lend themselves to games of brutal cunning, ruthlessness, and carving out your place while being beset by enemies on all sides. Pledging your sword to the Al-Mari, your coterie marks xp when they overcome obstacles with Dominance or Aggression.
House Elanda, the "Fist Around the Heart of Trade" lend themselves to games of controlling the markets, attracting singular talent, and manipulating the city for money and power. Serving as Elanda's thumb on the scale, your coterie marks xp when they overcome obstacles with Guile or Extortion.

campaign.story:
You abandoned your old life to work in tandem with the magician: the first person to show you that true magic exists in your world. When something goes horribly wrong and the magician gets himself into a bind he can’t escape, you must step forward to claim the gifts that have been yours all along, before it's too late to help him — or anyone else.

The Shape Of Shadows is a connected path game about show magic and true magic, the tension of asserting yourself as an equal to someone taking you under their wing; and the price you are willing to pay to fly on your own.
The Shape of Shadows can be adapted for players who prefer to write with brevity, using a bullet journal style of notation.
The Shape of Shadows is about a magician's assistant who, for their own reasons, dedicates their career to pursuing stage and close up magic through the mentorship of the magician. Through the eyes of the character they create, players will learn how the magician's assistant started the path they're on, how they chose to work with the magician, and why the risks and danger of learning true magic were not enough to deter them from their studies. Through intricately constructed journaling prompts, image- and word-based puzzles, and utilizing a mundane day planner to create strange alchemical rituals, players will explore the magic of the world they move through, in and out of this connected path game. The core game is played solo, but alongside everyone else who opens the door to the adventure and mystery at the heart of The Shape of Shadows. No two players' stories will be the same, but every player will walk their connected paths together through their play experiences.

A sampling of letters from former assistants for the players to discover in-game.
Connected path and keepsake games are two terms coined by Shing Yin Khor and myself during our collaboration on our previous game, Field Guide To Memory. In a connected path game, players experience unique, solitaire games while simultaneously sharing in a community of others engaging in the same creative spirit alongside them. 

The joy of playing a connected path the joy of show and tell: our intuitive desire to show each other what is precious to us, why we treasure it, and why we'd like to feel compelled to share it with the communities that are precious to us in turn. 
Playtester feedback on The Shape of Shadows was almost unanimous in its enthusiasm.
Both the narrative and core game experience in The Shape of Shadows center on a day planner. As the magician's assistant, much of your time in character will be spent interacting with the magician's planner, scouring it for keys to the doors he’s always kept closed to you, in order to learn what you need to restore him. 
An example of how some players answered game prompts in their planner by using color-coded index cards.
As the player, you will choose one month in a weekly planner to keep track of your character's increasingly strange appointments, while the rest of the planner undergoes a metamorphosis in your hands. Every day of play offers something new. Some days are contemplative, focusing on memory and observation in the form of journaling; others are adventurous and may lead you outside to find a token you need for a ritual circle; and still others involve trying your hand at more tangible crafts. 

Whether you're learning the nuances of different forms of sigil magic and how to work them into the trick locks you use during your close up magic shows; reviewing the finer points of talisman crafting to shield you from hecklers at the comedy club; charming your playing cards so they never tumble from your hands during a waterfall shuffle; or developing alchemical formulas for transmutation (that you can actually make in real life at home during the game!), it all goes in your planner to turn it page by page into a true magician's spellbook.
As far as you can tell, the magician devoted the entirety of his life to seeing how far he could push his skills in the practical application of true magic, and honing the craft of his show magic. Alchemy, cardistry, divination, illusionism, close-up, conjuring — nothing is off the table for him. 
Various letters from former magician's assistants over the years.
Over the course of his life the magician accumulated a veritable dragon's hoard of research materials, ritual components, flotsam and jetsam both figurative and literal (an avid beachcomber, the magician uses his findings often), and piles and piles of correspondence (some of it quite personal).
Almost every day during the game, you will receive 1-2(or more!) photographs and documentation of these objects as part of your gameplay prompts.
Two reward levels (the ILLUSIONIST and the CONJURER) include physical packages of these curiosities, mailed to you as part of the game's closing narrative.


LOCK, $15 (UNLIMITED) 
At the $15 KEY level, you will get added to the player list for The Shape of Shadow's live run in late summer. For the duration of the game's run you'll receive an email with story and activity prompts Monday through Thursday. The game lasts for four consecutive weeks.

KEY, $25 (UNLIMITED)
At the $25 LOCK level, you'll get everything associated with the live game, and a high resolution PDF of the full game text, sent to you after the live run wraps up. After her superlative layout work on Field Guide To Memory, Ruby Lavin will return to design The Shape of Shadows' PDF as well.

SLEIGHT, $40 (UNLIMITED)
At this level backers will get entry into the live game and the full game PDF for two recipients. 

ILLUSIONIST, $60 (UNLIMITED)
PLAY

All digital versions of the game, including the emailed live game experience in late summer, the full PDF, and large envelope of strange and beautiful paper ephemera, as described in the "Artifacts, Art, and Ephemera" section. Includes ephemera from the game narrative that your character or others may encounter during play, a sheet of custom-illustrated sigil stickers, and a sheet of holographic stamps showing a white rabbit popping in and out of a magician's hat. I am mountaineering up an exciting new learning curve and making this reward level unlimited.

CONJURER, $350 (LIMITED TO 60 BOXES)
An example of what a recipient of the Conjurer's box might receive.
In addition to everything at the ILLUSIONIST reward level, you will receive a literal one-of-a-kind collection of beautiful flotsam and jetsam just like the talismans and treasured detritus in the magician's office. Each box is numbered, since no two boxes are exactly the same, and all of them will have at least 1-2 pieces of my original art, in different mediums.

When I conceptualized this reward level, the thought that came to mind was "if a cabinet of curiosities could be ordered through delivery." The high level of care, craftsmanship, and artistic expression I want to put into each of these boxes is the kind of experiential feast I adore creating and sharing with people; and, in order to keep it sustainable, there is a strict limit of 60 of these boxes. 

Each collection box will be made, packed, lovingly fussed over, and shipped out a few at a time in order to avoid bottlenecking my home studio and office. If you back at this level, please note that another backer may receive their box long before you, depending on how many people end up supporting this level.

Creative Contributors
Amal El-Mohtar is an award-winning writer of fiction, poetry, and criticism. She is the science fiction and fantasy columnist for the New York Times Book Review and the co-author, with Max Gladstone, of This Is How You Lose the Time War, a novella which has received several honours including the Hugo, Nebula, BSFA, and Locus Awards. She lives in Ottawa with her spouse and two cats. Find her online at amalelmohtar.com.

Arabelle Sicardi is a beauty and fashion writer currently working on a nonfiction book on beauty called The House of Beauty. 

Banana Chan is a Chinese-Canadian/American TTRPG and board game writer, designer and publisher. She is the owner and co-founder of the publishing company, Game and a Curry. Some of her work has been on Jiangshi: Blood In the Banquet Hall, Van Richten’s Guide to Ravenloft, Scooby-Doo: Betrayal at Mystery Mansion and Questlings RPG. When she’s not busy working on games, she’s busy chasing pigeons out of her home.


Brennan Lee Mulligan is the creator and GM for Dimension 20, and a CollegeHumor cast member. He has taught and performed at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theater, co-created the webcomic Strong Female Protagonist, and written dozens of LARPs for the Wayfinder Experience summer camp in upstate New York. He recently started putting a little bit of cinnamon in his morning coffee, which he has described as "a real game changer."

DongWon Song is an agent at Howard Morhaim Literary Agency representing science fiction and fantasy for adults, young adult, and middle grade readers as well as select non-fiction. They were formerly an editor at Orbit, a product manager for an ebook startup, and has taught at institutions including Portland State University and New York University.

Jabari Weathers cannot confirm or deny their suspected status as an exiled goblin regent seeking refuge beyond the veil. They presently reside in Baltimore, Maryland, making fantasy and sci-fi illustrations and spinning worlds and fictions for roleplaying games and other interactive projects out of words to keep up their glamour. They've recently written for a variety of indie RPGs, as well as for Wizards of the Coast and Paizo. Other things that they enjoy are strange films, stranger music, singing in public places, and the thoroughly uncanny. You can follow them on Twitter and Instagram and contact them at jmwillustration@gmail.com



Kienna Shaw is a TTRPG designer, streamer, writer, and community creator. They have contributed to products such as Jiangshi: Blood in the Banquet Hall (Wet Ink Games), Sea of Legends (Guildhall Studios), and Candlekeep Mysteries (Wizards of the Coast). She has also self-published micro-RPGs on itchio and enjoys exploration of relationships, introspection, and big feelings through the medium of games.

Hugo award winner Sarah Gailey lives and works in California. Their nonfiction has been published by Mashable and the Boston Globe, and their fiction has been published internationally. Their debut novel, Magic for Liars, was an LA Times bestseller. Their most recent novel, The Echo Wife, is available now. You can find links to their work at www.sarahgailey.com. They tweet @gaileyfrey.

Sharang Biswas has won IndieCade and IGDN awards for roleplaying games, and has showcased interactive works at institutions such as The Institute of Contemporary Art in Philadelphia, Pioneer Works in Brooklyn, and The Museum of the Moving Image in Queens. He has written for games such as Spire, Sea of Legends, Jiangshi: Blood on the Banquet Hall, Into the Motherlands, and Dungeons & Dragons Live. He is the co-editor of “Honey & Hot Wax: An Anthology of Erotic Art Games” (Pelgrane Press), and “Strange Lusts / Strange Loves: An Anthology of Erotic Interactive Fiction” (Strange Horizons).

Stretch Goals

MET! The first stretch goal is to raise enough to hire a team of eight brilliant creators, all of them master magicians in their own right who understand the nature of true magic and will deliver it in their own unique ways to further build out the world with short fiction, in-character letters, clandestine texts, and other . Both this and the previous stretch goal will be made available to backers at all game levels. The incredible roster of writers and creators will be announced in stages once the stretch goal is met.

MET! The campaign's second stretch goal is to hire a cover artist to create a memorable, beautiful piece of art to capture the spirit of the game.
Isip Xin's conceptual sketch of their cover for the game
MET! The third stretch goal is to award a 50% raise to every contributor I asked on board for our first goal. This stretch goal is about getting money to people I love and admire, and about building a fair and sustainable model for indie game compensation.

MET! The fourth stretch goal is $50K, at which point I'll be able to make the Compendium: an appendix of supplementary mini games and multi-player ttrpgs that take place in the same world.

MET! The fifth stretch goal is $54K, which is where I'll be able to afford creating two sets of sigils for all backers: one set of full color, high resolution digital downloads for players who are joining the live game or buying the PDF text, and high quality sticker sheets for players who are backing the physical ephemera reward levels.

MET! At $60K, I'll be able to triple the base pay for all of the creative contributors on the game! 

MET! At $66K I'll be able to pay a bonus to literally everyone contributing to the game!

Stretch Goal no. 8: $72K Mid-week Intermission Game, live on Twitter!
At $66K, I'll make time to write a play-by-poll game on Twitter that dovetails with the core game experience, and is also run in real time. Each intermission game will consist of three parts, and be open to the general public!
 Jeeyon Shim is a second generation Korean American game designer, multimedia artist, and outdoor educator based in California. Her work is defined by her lyrical prose and ability to reconnect people to themselves, their communities, and the natural world that holds them all. Jeeyon’s games have been featured on Polygon, Shut Up and Sit Down, and Dicebreaker, among other publications. Other notables include working as artist in residence at the Heart of the Deernicorn, serving as Keynote Speaker at Big Bad Con, and several years as a program coordinator for an outdoor education company, where she designed live action roleplaying games that taught real world wilderness survival skills to children. She is absolutely, 100% that audience member who involuntarily shouts "HOW DID THEY DO THAT?" after a particularly well executed trick. If you know any magic tricks she definitely wants to see them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Shape of Shadows is my third Kickstarter; my two most recent Kickstarters (Field Guide To Memory and The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe) were met with enthusiastic success, both projects funding in their first forty minutes and selling out of all their physical reward levels in less. This game builds further on the scaffold of everything I’ve learned from those experiences.

The game is fully structured and written, albeit in an unedited late-stage draft. The Kickstarter funds will cover the cost of copy editing by Ryan Boyd, and layout design by Ruby Lavin (whose previous layout credits include Field Guide To Memory and Wanderhome), as well as giving me the time I need to attend to the creative and administrative tasks associated with the multifaceted nature of connected path games like this one. Short of Mailchimp’s server going down or a street magician accidentally turning me into a rabbit, I anticipate fulfillment of the text and live game to stay on schedule.

I do not currently have a fulfillment partner for the Illusionist reward level (the flat art and ephemera), but I'm in touch with two or three companies and will contract the most suitable once I know what quantity of printed goods I'll need to ship. While the USPS is generally reliable for domestic US mail, with any physical reward there is always the risk of packages getting delayed or lost in thin air. 

Additionally, the future of international mail sent out of the US is currently hard to read in the cards. I fully intend to work with my future fulfillment partner to send out every single package that is backed and accounted for, but be aware that it could take a very long time for your rewards to reach you. (Due to various plant pressings and organic materials in the Conjurer's boxes, I cannot ship that reward level internationally and it will be limited to US backers.)

My aim is to fulfill this Kickstarter from late July to August, well before the stated delivery dates. Still, I left myself enough buffer to weather most unexpected changes. Overall, I anticipate a strong, efficient, and invigorating Kickstarter campaign, and I am already looking forward to it!

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
I design my games and the skills that I teach through them to be meaningful to the player, and made in a way that will last a long time. When players connect deeply with what they create, they are more likely to keep and treasure their work — thus being far less likely to end up throwing their creations out as waste materials.
Reusability and recyclability
Players will repurpose various pieces of ephemera from their own lives, thereby saving them from turning into waste! 

Many of my materials for the Conjurer's Boxes are sourced from local secondhand shops or my own stores of various odds and ends.

Additionally, many players have collections of journals that they can source from, further reducing the environmental toll of new manufacturing.
Sustainable materials
Players will be sourcing their own journals for play, making impact individual and less impactful.
Environmentally friendly factories
All my vendors are based in the United States, and all the vendors I plan to hire for the Illusionist's printing needs are specifically local to my city.
Sustainable Distribution
All packaging and shipping materials I will personally use to pack the Conjurer's boxes are made from 100% recycled matter. Once I know who I will be working with as my fulfillment partner, I will make sure to emphasize that I expect to use uncoated recyclable paper materials, and if we must use plastics I will strive to opt for packaging that is made from 100% post-consumer goods.

campaign.story:
Corsairs of Cthulhu:  Fighting Mythos in the Golden Age of Piracy, is a Call of Cthulhu 7th edition source book  licensed by Chaosium. The book will feature the beautiful art work of  Joel Bisaillon,  brought to you by New Comet Games, the same people who brought you the award-winning Call of Cthulhu book Devil's Swamp.
Corsairs of Cthulhu is a rules and setting supplement to the Call of Cthulhu role-playing game and focuses on the period between 1650 and 1730 CE. Your keeper can set up your investigators as crew on a pirate or privateer ship, freelancers in one of the Caribbean ports who love the gold doubloon more than a foreign governments rule, or even provide your investigators with their own ship. Working together the investigators must face evil Mythos, real and imagined. Curses left by ancient civilizations and hidden nightmares around the world.
The golden age of piracy is a time of spreading empires. England, France, Spain, Italy as well as several other smaller countries are planting their flags and colonies on any piece of land they can find. Empires rise and fall, Spanish ships are hauling new found gold from the new world back to Spain and ships are lost to pirates and storms regularly. Governments authorize privateers to sail under their flag but can raise the black when needed.
 There are new skills, new professions, famous NPCs and new weapons that the investigators must learn to use if they want to survive against not only the dangers of the Mythos, but also against disease, dehydration, sea monsters, warships, and other pirates.
Corsairs of Cthulhu is not just a setting book anticipated to be approximately 360 pages, but also contains a full campaign, The Map of the Astronomer. This campaign will take your investigators to ports unknown, fantastical lands out of this world and come face to face with some of the most dangerous Elder Gods and dark creatures ever faced. Can anything prepare the investigators for the finale and the most terrifying deity of all time.
Many of the adventures could be run as standalone, but it is designed as a full campaign. Your ship and ports of call will provide replacement investigators as needed.

We will be sending out a quick survey to everyone this morning. All we are really looking for is if you do have a physical book, where will it be shipped.  If you don't have a physical book, are you planning to upgrade to one, and if so where will it be shipped.

We've broken it down into 5 choices. USA, Canada, EU/Europe, Australia and Everywhere else.

After 30 days, 841 backers, 16 Updates, 10 Stretch Goals, 660 books sold and almost $55 thousand dollars, the campaign is finally done. Thank you all so much for supporting us.
We did fall $138 short of the 10th stretch goal, but we wanted to thank you for all your support and unlocked the 10th Stretch goal right before we ended. We will be adding in the Pulp material so you have the option to play as standard Call of Cthulhu, or use the Pulp Cthulhu rules. 
We will be doing monthly updates to give you status on where we stand and % completed.  So expect to see those. We have a lot of work to do, but tonight, we are going to relax, celebrate and get busy tomorrow.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu 9th Stretch Goal Reached!
updates.update_content:
We Unlocked the 9th Stretch Goal tonight with 21 hours left to go.  We are still going strong and if we can just do a bit better in this last day, as we did today, we have a chance to get to that huge 10th Stretch Goal and add in the Pulp Cthulhu options.
For the 9th Goal we will be adding in at least 2 more Plot hook/Adventure ideas for you as the Keeper to give you ideas to run your adventures. We have been brainstorming some here, and have some wickedly creepy ideas, we think you will love.

What an exciting finish to this record breaking campaign for us. We are so pleased by everyone jumping in and helping out. Things are moving along smoothly and we expect to easily reach the next Stretch Goal #9. But we are worried about reaching #10, the Pulp Cthulhu level. We know some of you would not be interested in this, but many are very interested. Help us reach that goal.  We just passed 700 backers and are hoping to reach 800!

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu: 8th Stretch Goal Reached!
updates.update_content:
3rd Weeks can always be tough, but we continued to grow all week and just a few minutes ago we surpassed the 8th Stretch Goal. 
What does this do for you? We already have the map for the Cronus which is a large Armed Brig, and we will also be putting in the typical Corsair ship, and now we will be adding a 3rd ship map. These will help you with ship to ship combats and being able to provide ships for players.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu: The Astronomer's Map
updates.update_content:
Just wanted to jump on and talk a little about the Astronomer's Map. A lot of you have purchased the Physical Copy Complete Level, which gives you a bunch of goodies but the big item is the 3d printed Map and Key.
The campaign kicks off with your captain owning one of the pieces and driven to find the rest. In the first scene you acquire the 2nd piece of the map and the main part of the key.

We are in the slow 3rd week right now, this is pretty normal, but we are still climbing up and are well over half-way to the next stretch goal. 
We wanted to let everyone know we have received the 3d printed model of the Astronomers map and Key and we'll be making a video this week to show it off.  It looks great!
We also wanted to share our first Cartography map. We hope you enjoy this.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu: 7th Stretch Goal Reached!
updates.update_content:
We hit the next stretch goal, which will add in at least 2 new plot hooks/adventure ideas into the book. We will stay away from the movie tropes that have been put into films (ie. cursed treasure that turns you undead, etc..) and we will stay away from the ideas I've already included in the campaign.  
We will be taking suggestions from you and if we get several ideas we like we may add more than two. So feel free to send us ideas and we'll start a list to go with our own and pick the ones we like the best.

We are coming up on the half-way point of the campaign and continue to grow and could not be happier. We are quickly closing in on the next stretch goal, only a few hundred left. 
We are also working on our maps and art, and it is rolling in. Meanwhile the campaign is rolling along and every play session is invaluable in continuing to make the book better, and batter.

campaign.story:
GRAY is a radical rework of the classic Oscar Wilde novel; a supernatural revenge thriller about a beautiful, debauched and dangerous woman, DORIAN GRAY, and her mission of retribution.  Written by Stoker-nominated and Audible best-selling author Arvind Ethan David, GRAY is told both as a beautiful graphic novel, with art by Eugenia Koumaki, Diana Greenhalgh and Joana Lafuente,  and as an all-star,  full-cast audiodrama. 
This Kickstarter is to:
#1 produce a fully dramatized, scripted audiodrama, with amazing music, sound design and an all-star cast
#2 fund Volume 2 of the graphic novel including printing and full artwork 
The Picture of Dorian Gray, Oscar Wilde’s only novel and one of the classics of gothic literature,  is the tale of the most beautiful man of his age, who sells his soul and his conscience in exchange for eternal youth, beauty, and power — and who spends his life murdering, raping and corrupting.  All the time in his attic, his picture degrades and rots.
GRAY flips the original's moral framework and gender archetypes: our DORIAN GRAY is a social media princess who drifts through the coolest cliques of NYC, living the most debauched of lives, breaking hearts and turning heads wherever she goes.  But Dorian has secrets.  For one thing, she’s a violent criminal.  For another, she’s an immortal creature of magic, hell set on a mission of revenge against some of America's most powerful men. 
We're in the final STRETCH!
See all the options under "Rewards"!
$100 Tier
$150 Tier
Jagged Little STAN!
Your own picture of Dorian... in full color! Get this 4 postcard set!
Dorian Gray - Frozen in Enamel // Dorian Gray Enamel Pin
Add-On Item for Physical Reward Tiers
Gray Volume 1 - Please note the final version will be hardback & not include the red "Advanced Readers Copy" text at the top.
Gray Volume 1 - Please note the final version will be a hardback
GRAY remains true to Wilde’s spirit of pushing every boundary, creative, sexual, and of exposing the pervasive hypocrisy of society, but we apply his lens to our era - the time of #MeToo and #DefundThePolice.  Our characters cover the spectrum of sexual and gender identity,  and like their Wildean originals, they debate, in sparkling witticisms, the most serious issues of our time. These include: Sexual Assault and the #MeToo movement; gender identity and sexual orientation and the prejudice LGTBQ+ people suffer and Systemic Racism.
GRAY has partnered with RAINN, the nation’s largest anti-sexual violence organization to provide resources to readers, listeners and our cast and company around the charged issues that the story explores. Please see the bottom of our page for more info on RAINN. 
Whilst an innocent student in the 1980s, a young woman named Dorian Gray was subjected to a ritualized assault at the hands of a cabal of ambitious men.  It was in that moment that she became something both more and less than human.  
Now, 40 years later, but not a day older, she’s ready for her revenge. To destroy the men who wronged her, but more importantly, to end once and for all the culture of sexual predators and casual abuse.  Gray believes the system can never serve women, so she's going to destroy it. 
Then Dorian meets Detective HANK WUTAN, the Black NYPD detective assigned to stop these crimes.  Hank has his own demons and his own issues with the system he's pledged to serve, but he's an incremental, cautious reformer by nature.  A rule follower. Police. 
Despite all that, and despite the fact that Dorian is his suspect number one, they fall for each other,  hard.

GRAY takes Wilde’s classic novel and reinvents it as a tale of cathartic revenge for the #MeToo era, a story about dangerous women and corrupt men, about sexual power and predators, about guilt and consequences and about the different ways of changing the world: those who would burn it down to start again, and those who would work from within to reform it.
… and about how a murderous, privileged, debauched she-demon and a law-abiding Black detective can be soul mates.
The audio drama tells Dorian's story as a true-crime investigative podcast hosted, 20 years after the events of the book,  by the mysterious Speranza- a new character, determined for reasons of her own to figure out the truth of what happened to Dorian Gray, and to tease out the implications of her terrible crimes.  Set to release in Fall 2021.  
The Audiobook isn't a book on tape, it isn't an ordinary podcast, rather a fully reinvented adaptation designed solely for audio.  With an amazing cast and some of the top sound designers from the world of film and television,  we are playing with the form in the same way that Orson Welles did with War of the Worlds --  creating a fiction so convincing it's better than the truth.
Meet our wonderful cast, which includes some of our favorite people from Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency and Jagged Little Pill :
The Audiobook Team
Dorian Gray's story is told in full-colour...  We're halfway there, but we need your help to tell her full story! 
The graphic novel has been written as two volumes for release 
Volume 1 contains Chapters 1 - 5, will be released for sale on July 2021
Volume 2 contains chapters 6 - 9 + an (epic) epilogue has been written - and with your help, it could be released October 2021!

RAINN (Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network) is the nation's largest anti-sexual violence organization. RAINN created and operates the National Sexual Assault Hotline (800.656.HOPE, online.rainn.org y rainn.org/es) in partnership with more than 1,000 local sexual assault service providers across the country. RAINN also carries out programs to prevent sexual violence, help survivors, and ensure that perpetrators are brought to justice.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
-Do you know how to make an audiobook / podcast / audio drama?

Well, the last record we made, the "Jagged Little Pill" original cast recording won a freaking Grammy... 

And the last time we made an audio drama, "The Neil Gaiman at the End of the Universe" it went to the top 10 chart on Audible and got universally rave reviews. 

-Do you know how to make a graphic novel?

Last time Arvind wrote one, (DARKNESS VISIBLE) it got nominated for a Stoker Award and got optioned as a TV series. And our publishers Clover Press have put out literally dozens. 

-Do you know how to reboot a literary classic without messing it up?

Last time we did it, right here on Kickstarter, with MOTHER OF FRANKENSTEIN, we were fully funded in 24 hours and the game closed a global distribution deal and will be in stores (and in backers hands) by Q4.

updates.update_content: “Actors are so fortunate. They can choose whether they will appear in tragedy or in comedy, whether they will suffer or make merry, laugh or shed tears. But in real life it is different. Most men and women are forced to perform parts for which they have no qualifications. The world is a stage, but the play is badly cast.”

My Lords, Ladies & Lovers:

We seek meaning in numerology.  Looking for affirmation from rolls of the dice.  We seek significance anywhere we can, fearing the terror of a random universe,  fearing god doesn't love us as our parents did.

A message from Dorian Gray... 
I have just been informed that volume 1 of my graphical biography has been sent to the printers.  How exciting, how splendid, how thoroughly captivating.  But enough about me.  Thank you to all of you for your support and confidence.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When you pledge on Kickstarter you put your trust in a project long before it is completed and you contribute to making Stationfall a reality. We are grateful for the trust you show us! 

Although we have the best laid out plans and a generous timeline, there might be bumps in the road since there are so many different external partners (manufacturer, fulfillment center, etc). The estimated time of delivery may change due to this, but we are continuously improving the way we manufacture and deliver games based on experience from previous projects, and hope to be able to avoid delays. 

Another factor that is influencing the world right now is the covid-19 outbreak, which is constantly evolving and continues to escalate globally. This is a stressful time for all of us and we are hoping it gets better soon. At the moment Ion Game Design continues as usual here in Sweden, but we have found playtesting has taken longer and become more difficult during a pandemic. We are in contact with our partners to be able to give all our backers continuous updates. Since it is several months before we will start shipping it is difficult to say what the situation looks like then. We feel confident that we will be able to tackle potential bumps on the production and fulfilment road and we will keep you updated about the process along the way. 

At Ion we have a clear understanding about responsibility, quality, and professionalism

campaign.story:
Blue Planet is a compelling RPG journey into humanity’s precarious future on a distant waterworld where political unrest and a hungry alien ecology threaten the nascent colony effort. A planet where GEO marshals struggle to maintain peace, Incorporate mercenaries wage amphibious proxy wars, and native insurgents fight for their adopted world. A frontier where human desperation and corporate greed ravage an uncanny ecology, threatening to plunge humanity into a war of survival with an ancient, alien legacy. 
Though the original Blue Planet predates many of these titles, the setting is evoked by the movies Avatar, Blade Runner and Outland, the television series The Expanse, Firefly and Earth II and the books Legacy of Heorot, Songs of Distant Earth and the Mars Trilogy. A reviewer once gave a glib but accurate elevator pitch for Blue Planet as "Space marshal Cowboy and his cybernetic dolphin sidekick fight eco-crimes in alien Hawaii." 
Diptych Book Covers
The Full Premise 
Blue Planet's uniqueness and enduring appeal are in its deep, realistic, hard science fiction setting, and to really describe it requires more than a few sentences. For those new to the waterworld, we recommend exploring the more detailed premise here.
This campaign will fund the production of a new third edition of the critically acclaimed Blue Planet roleplaying game. We’ve brought Blue Planet to Kickstarter because we're excited to make the definitive edition of the game, but we need your help to do that.
We want to design a uniquely beautiful, full-color, two-volume, 600-page masterpiece, overflowing with evocative art, captivating text, and exceptional production values. We want to make the books themselves works of art with UV cover highlights, endpaper maps and page-marking ribbons. We want to fill them with a new rules set, stunning art, expansive color maps and compelling new locations, social structures, future technologies and alien secrets.
These features and content exceed our capacity to resource on our own, so we are here asking you to join the Blue Planet team and help us make the new version of this classic game truly exceptional. 
Player's and Moderator's Guides - 300 pages each
Download the Blue Planet: Recontact Quickstart Guide here. This 80+ page, full color primer is free and contains the new version of the rules, a setting sampler and a demo scenario called "Trouble in Paradise," complete with ready-to-play characters.
Draft Layout
The Recontact project includes
• An extensive evolution of the core mechanics, taking advantage of two decades of RPG development. The new system can be found here in our free, 80+ page Recontact primer.
• All new, full-color artwork bringing the waterworld to life in stunning, evocative imagery.
• Full-color world and regional maps, including submarine geography, redesigned and rendered by professional cartographer and game designer Mark Richardson (Green Hat Design).
• A series of campaign archetypes to help moderators jumpstart their games in the vast adventure space of Poseidon (see below).
• Updated speculative technologies.
• New sociopolitical systems, organizations, institutions and conflicts.
• New locations, settlements and facilities.
Sample of the Newly Rendered Maps
The Recontact project does not include
• Fundamental changes to the core sociopolitical tensions - the themes will remain staunchly pro-environmental and anti-colonial. 
• Timeline advancements - the setting was originally - and intentionally - poised on a sociopolitical precipice, rife with plot and storytelling potential, and we want to maintain that same narrative tension.
• Global rewrites of the setting material - though updates, sensitivity edits and additions are being made throughout, we believe Blue Planet’s deep setting is why the game has endured, and so we are not making major alterations to that essential content.
A word about the delivery date
We know a reward delivery date of October 2022 seems unexpectedly far away. Though we intend to deliver Blue Planet sooner, our experience, and the last year in particular, have proven an essential truth about Kickstarter management - set a generous delivery date, then add six months. We hope this date does not discourage folks from becoming backers, but instead demonstrates our commitment to realistic planning and transparent communication. 
All reward tiers (digital and physical) will receive PDFs of the out-of-print Blue Planet books the day after the campaign ends. Single book pledges will receive the corresponding v2 PDF, and book set pledges will receive copies of everything ever published for the line. All 10 past Blue Planet titles - over 1700 pages of waterworld adventure - as immediate rewards!
First edition Blue Planet, Archipelago, Access Denied, v2 Blue Planet Player's and Moderator's Guides, Fluid Mechanics, First Colony, Frontier Justice, Natural Selection and Ancient Echoes.
Archipelago - 1st ed. Gazetteer
Blue Planet has received broad acclaim, particularly for its deep, detailed, and realistic setting, and has remained well regarded since its original publication. However, that publication was almost 25 years ago, and in the intervening decades, all versions have gone out of print and game design has evolved dramatically. We are therefore excited at the prospect of giving the game system an overdue overhaul and the opportunity to share Blue Planet with a new generation of players.  
Interior Art Sample - Native Pod Passing Dyfed
More personally, Blue Planet features critical environmental themes, presenting a precarious future threatened by the dire consequences of ecological collapse. If issues like biodiversity loss, ocean acidification and climate change were only obscure concerns within the scientific community 25 years ago, they are now clear and present existential threats to the human species. This new edition will let us add our own small voice to those demanding true stewardship of our original blue planet.
Compelled by these reasons, the original creators at Biohazard Games have teamed up with publisher Gallant Knight Games to produce a modern edition of this classic RPG. 
Interior Art Sample - Moon Pool Intrusion
Recontact is the in-game term for the fateful day in 2165 when the UNSS Admiral Robert Perry entered orbit around Poseidon, “reestablishing contact” with Earth 69 years after the original colonists were abandoned. Given that more than two decades have passed since the publication of the first edition of Blue Planet, RECONTACT seemed a fitting subtitle for this new version of the game.
Anyone familiar with Blue Planet v2’s Synergy rules will recognize the new system as a modern evolution of those mechanics, sharing a little of that design's genetics and the same intent to support the hard science realism of the setting. Players will also find the new system is simultaneously simpler and more robust, while supporting richer, more evocative character creation that's focused as much on who characters are as what characters can do. 
Draft Character Sheets
Characters have 4 attributes with optional foci and up to 8 skill sets - areas of expertise based on player-generated descriptors that evoke a character’s origins, training, occupation and experiences. The core mechanic is roll ≤ (attribute rank)+(skill set rank). The roll is made with either 1, 2 or 3 d10, depending upon whether the general, core or specialty in a given skill set is being used. For those who know v2, these elements should seem familiar. There are fewer attributes, but they work similarly, and the variable dice pool is a streamlined take on the aptitude mechanic. The skill sets are simultaneously simpler and more robust than the long list of specific aptitudes and skills in the 2nd edition. 
Blue Planet does remain a realistically dangerous game, keeping the  wound levels and trauma tests from the 2nd edition. Weapons and sea monsters are therefore quite deadly, so characters should try to avoid getting shot. Or eaten.
Interior Art Sample - Work in Progress 1 - Greater White Attack
Interior Art Sample - Work in Progress 2 - Greater White Attack
Interior Art Sample - Final Image - Greater White Attack
The new mechanics also lean in to the qualitative roleplaying aspects of modern character design, providing Tags, Tracks and Ties unique to each player's character concept and each moderator's campaign. The emphasis is as much on who a character is as what they can do. 
Tags are specific consequences, benefits, convictions, motivations or other active descriptors that a character incurs during their adventures - generally the result of narrative events, important tests, fallout from interactions with other characters and injuries.
Tracks model the range of specific character emotions, attitudes and mental states. They are usually campaign or party specific and can be offered by the moderator or created by the players for their party or their individual characters.
Ties describe a character’s primary relationships, identifying the people and organizations to whom the character is connected, as well as the nature of the obligations they must meet to maintain those relationships.
The only consistent criticism Blue Planet has received over the years is that the setting is so vast and wide open, it’s often challenging for game moderators to know where to start. They struggle to choose a single campaign current from among the sea of ideas in the setting. Blue Planet: Recontact will therefore provide a diverse set of campaign archetypes to provide ready-made options for GMs new to the game.
It’s common practice for RPG books to present a range of character archetypes, providing players with detailed examples of the kinds of PCs available to play. These campaign archetypes are similar providing GMs with starting points, directions and enough details to get a variety of different campaigns underway. Each archetype outlines a premise, PC suggestions, unique NPCs, key locations, resources, themes, and plot threads from which a GM can build their perfect Blue Planet campaign.
Sample Campaign Archetype
Read the full first example - Red Sky Charters - in the Recontact Primer here. 
The project has a list of exciting stretch goals to further enhance the game with additional setting content, player support, scientific resources and even a potential glimpse through another wormhole. 
$32,500 - Guest Author Campaign Archetypes: Three additional campaign hooks created by luminaries in the RPG industry, offering new and creative directions to take your Blue Planet adventures. 
Elizabeth Chaipraditkul
Graeme Barber
Mari Murdock
These bonus archetypes will be added to those already planned for the Moderator's Guide. 
$35,000 - More Maps: We will commission two additional maps from the amazing Mark Richardson. As we reach higher funding levels,  we'll add even more maps to his production list. 
$37,500 - PC Species Trio: A collection of three new player character species will be added to the Player's Guide.
"Skink"  - a third-generation, herptile-based hybrid genie with unique senses, enhanced durability and rapid healing. This species was developed on Mars and subsequently recruited in surprising numbers to Poseidon as Incorporate colonists. 
"Xeno" - a rare individual who has had the full rejuvenating and longevity benefits of Xenosilicate therapy since its inception - a member of a generation of newly immortal Incorporate elites whose privilege and resources are quickly outstripping the rest of humanity's.
Sperm Whale - the cloned and artificially gestated, uplifted members of a cohort of two dozen sperm whales released on Poseidon by an egomaniacal oligarch obsessed with cetacean sapience. (Yeah, this one will be a role playing challenge, for sure!)
$40,000 - Station Trio: Gazetteer entries for three new, high-tech, high-pressure adventure locations will be added into the Moderator's Guide.
Down Home Station - the GEO's state-of-the-art underwater research city - the high water mark of the Organization's influence on Poseidon.  Down Home is a place of shining science, high technology, cutthroat competition and dangerous secrets.  
Lesear High Orbital - the sprawling space platform that serves as one of Poseidon's primary orbital dockyards, transit hubs and spacer habitats. The station is a zero-g facility where trade, politics and greed fuse together behind pressurized bulkheads while its elite and powerful occupants look down on the ocean world below. 
Proteus Landing - the Incorporate research cooperative on the water planet's oversized, biome-supporting moon. Research, rivalries and relationships create ever-changing, always challenging sources of adventure on this isolated outpost. 
$42,500 - Increased Art Commission: At this funding level, we will commission an additional ten pieces of interior art for the project. As we continue to raise funds past this level, our goal is to work towards a fully illustrated field guide.
$45,000 - UV Spot Gloss Cover & Ribbon Bookmark: At this funding level, we'll add  ribbon bookmarks to each offset printed book, as well as enhance the cover with UV spot gloss to make Jeff Zugale's fantastic cover art jump right off the page. 
$47,500 - Increased Art Commission: At this funding level, we will commission an additional ten pieces of interior art for the project. As we continue to raise funds past this level, our goal is to work towards a fully illustrated field guide.
$50,000 - Slipcase: A beautiful, two-book slipcase, intended to embossed with the submarine topography of the Pacifica Archipelago. The final slipcase might vary or change based on production needs, but we'll make it as nice as we can! All two-book sets ($100 pledge level or higher) will receive this upgrade as part of the pledge.
Interior Art Sample - Amphibious Recon
$52,500 - GEO Commission and Incorporate Logo Designs: Rendered logos lending each significant Colonial Commission and Incorporate nation unique visual identity and style. These will be incorporated throughout the books.
$55,000 - The Outback: An all-new, full gazetteer section for the little explored and even less inhabited "backside" hemisphere of Poseidon. Includes a new map commission, regional descriptions, outposts and Most Wanted NPCs. 
$57,500 - Wormhole: A 10k-word exposé outlining the secrets of the...REDACTED...and their ancient...REDACTED... This is a setting-changing resource for moderators who want to take their players on the ultimate Blue Planet adventure. 
$60,000 - Scientific Archive: We will curate an online library of speculative technology and essential oceanographic, marine biology and xenobiological resources that will provide verisimilitude for adventures on the water world and environmental education for players and moderators alike. This living resource will be a webpage accessible to all backers. 
$62,500 - Increased Art Commission: At this funding level, we will commission an additional ten pieces of interior art for the project. As we continue to raise funds past this level, our goal is to fully illustrate the "Poseidon Field Guide."
$65,000 - Web Apps: We will commission a web app developer to build two Blue Planet: Recontact themed in-game apps for use in play. 
Poseidon/Earth Date Synchronizer - a quick conversion calculator that matches Earth normal with Poseidon normal dates. 
Incorporate Script Exchange Rate Tracker - an exchange rate generator that tracks and displays the daily variations and exchange rates between the relative values of the major Incorporate script. 
We never expected to get this far, and so never thought we would get to share these, but we are excited to offer even more stretch goal enhancements and additions to the project. 
$67,500 - GM Screen Inserts: At this funding level, we will provide inserts for customizable game screens. They will feature at least one custom landscape image on the front panels and a collection of essential moderator information on the back panels. The inserts will be sized to fit the Hammerdog GM Screen offered by DTRPG and provided in both portrait and landscape formats. Backers will be given a POD code for at-cost purchase through DTRPG, but will be responsible for all shipping and at-cost printing fees. Backers will also be provided files that will allow them to print their own inserts or have them commercially produced at their local print shop.
$70,000 - Map Card Player Handouts: At this level, we will convert the maps created for the game into US letter-sized, card stock player handouts. The collection will also include additional four-panel sets that can be assembled into larger versions of the major world maps and laid out on the table top to accessorize play. Backers will be given a POD code for at-cost purchase through DTRPG, but will be responsible for all shipping and at-cost printing fees. Backers will also be provided files that will allow them to print their own map panels or have them commercially produced at their local print shop.
$75,000 - Hardware Spot Illustrations: This funding level will allow us to produce twice the number of spot illustrations for the equipment chapter of the project. Twice the vehicles, robots, remotes, biomods and weapons!
$77,500 - Settlement Maps: At this level, we will commission detailed settlement maps for the colonial capital of Haven, Lavender Organics’ famous floating city of Dyfed, and the GEO’s grand scientific and social experiment, Down Home Station.
$80,000 - World of Hurt: This funding level will allow us to produce a 10k-word overview of life on Earth, detailing the unrecognizable, post-Blight political landscape and the economic stranglehold of the Incorporate nations. It will address the rising and increasingly violent unrest of the Earth's population and lean into the legacy of environmental destruction and rampant capitalism that has left the planet on the brink of social and ecological collapse. This reward will be offered in PDF format only.
$85,000 - Fully Illustrated Field Guide: If we reach this goal, we will commit to fully illustrating the Poseidon field guide entries - more than 60 spot illustrations featuring the often frightening, sometimes bizarre, frequently majestic, but always fascinating creatures of Poseidon’s alien ecology.
$90,000 - Storm Surge Adventure Trio: At this funding level, we will produce a three-scenario set, suitable for use as standalone adventures or as an interconnected campaign. The scenarios will trace the rising tide of conflict between the Incorporate city states and the native insurgency and follow the seemingly vain efforts of the GEO to keep peace on the waterworld. The players can be of any or related factions, and depending upon their interests, moderators can lead the story directly into the secrets of Wormhole. This reward will be offered in PDF format only.
$100,000 - Wormhole Bonus Content and Print-on-Demand: At this funding level, we'll double the size of Wormhole to 20k words and produce a POD version of the book. After all, even these extra pages will not be enough to contain all the secrets we want to share. Backers will get a POD code for at-cost purchase though DTRPG, but will be responsible for all shipping and at-cost printing fees. Please note that production logistics mean this book may be delivered after the primary rewards of the campaign.
With 22 stretch goals already funded and the end of the campaign in sight, we want to offer a final wave of cool additions to the project.
$107,000 - Virtual Table Top Assets: Funding this goal will provide a collection of Blue Planet: Recontact resources (maps, counters, artwork) in generic formats that can be downloaded from DriveThruRPG and used on most online, RPG virtual play platforms. We will also produce a number of platform-specific, automated character sheets - the given platforms will depend on development costs. 
$114,000 - Travel Time and Weather Apps: This level will add two additional, in-game apps to compliment the date and exchange rate calculator stretch goal. The first will provide inter-settlement distances with travel times, and the second will provide daily weather forecasts by planetary region.
$120,000 - World of Hurt Bonus Content and Print-on-Demand: At this funding level, we'll double the size of World of Hurt to 20k words and produce a POD version of the book. There are too many tales of trial and triumph to be told on Earth in 2199 not to give you more room to play there. Backers will be given a POD code for at-cost purchase though DTRPG, but will be responsible for all shipping and at-cost printing fees. Please note that production logistics mean this book may be delivered after the primary rewards of the campaign.
Above $120,000: Any funds raised beyond this level will go toward improving the quality of the core books and previously unlocked stretch goals with more illustrations, maps, freelance assignments and production upgrades. We are intentionally ending itemized stretch goals here so that we do not risk “mission creep” and overload production. We are dedicated to keeping the scope manageable and the project moving forward. This campaign has been a wonderful and surprising success, and we want to be certain we deliver as promised. Thank you for your faith, generosity and ongoing support.

Please note that the shipping costs listed below are estimates only, based on current shipping prices. Changes and fluctuations are not only possible but highly likely! 
US Shipping
Based on experience shipping in the USA, we've worked to establish a new shipping rate for Kickstarters, and this is the debut of that hard work:
For book-only pledges, we charge a flat $8 shipping charge (media mail + packaging and handling costs) for USA addresses. This includes tracking delivered to your email.
For pledges that include more than books (items such as dice, cards or tokens), we have to increase the cost to $15 (priority mail + packaging and handling costs).
We always do our best to keep shipping affordable by doing our own fulfillment so we can ensure it's done right.
EU Shipping
For orders in the EU, our friends at Angry Hamster Publishing are handling our Kickstarter fulfillment.
For book-only pledges, we charge a flat €10 shipping charge (the shipping costs + packaging and handling costs) for EU addresses. We're still exploring tracking options and will share those details when we have them. 
For pledges that include more than books (items such as dice, cards or tokens), we have to increase the cost to €25 (a larger package + packaging and handling costs). These packages are tracked.
Because these packages will be shipping from inside the EU, VAT and Customs fees will not apply!
UK Shipping
For book-only pledges, we use Royal Mail, which is relatively inexpensive. Unfortunately, we can't currently offer a firm price as rate increases are imminent in the UK.
For pledges that include more than books (items such as dice, cards or tokens), unfortunately, we can't give a firm price as rate increases are imminent in the UK. We will use the Parcelforce service.
Our fulfillment team will updated numbers soon, and we'll post those ASAP.
The Rest of the World
We recommend you look into the options below for print-on-demand. If you still want an offset book, you're welcome to back at the appropriate level, but you will be charged full shipping, and we will be unable to offer refunds of your pledge if shipping ends up more than you expected. It can get very expensive - effectively doubling the cost of your pledge - so please be aware before you pledge. 
If you need an estimate, don't hesitate to reach out to shipping@gallantknightgames.com
If You're Concerned About Shipping Costs...
We are exploring having the Blue Planet: Recontact books in print on demand on DriveThruRPG. We fully intend to offer POD options if we can do so appropriately. Any extra offset print run will be sold via our webstore, and you can always get books there, but the high shipping concerns still exist.
All of our digital rewards - and our print on demand rewards - are being handled by our fulfillment partners at DriveThruRPG.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Biohazard/Gallant Knight Games partnership represents decades of experience in RPG production, and its members have collectively brought dozens of acclaimed game titles to life. They are skilled creators, capable production managers and experienced industry professionals. Though this is only Biohazard's second Kickstarter, Gallant Knight Games and its principal Alan Bahr have brought over 20 Kickstarter campaigns to completion under the GKG banner, as well as helped to deliver other projects (including troubled or disrupted ones) and understands how to execute on funded projects. There is always the possibility of unforeseen events delaying production, but Blue Planet is as sure an RPG investment as Kickstarter has to offer.

Q: Can Biohazard/Gallant Knight Games handle this project?
Gallant Knight Games has run over 20 projects (even more as a consultant) and worked with Biohazard before, so we're bringing a wealth of experience to the table. We're aiming for an ambitious project, something big and exciting here, so while there will inevitably be hiccups, we're equipped to manage them.

Q: What if the text or art isn't finished?
A: 85% of the text is done and the rest is outlined. Artists have been contracted, and we've already invested considerable money into the project and will see it to the end.

Q: What about delays in art?
A: We've already begun the process of commissioning the core art assets for the game, and we're really pleased with the work so far. If there are issues or delay on the art, we also have back-up artists who are ready work.

Q: Increase in shipping costs?
A: Shipping costs constantly rise, and while we've projected them to the best of our abilities, there's not a lot we can do if they change. However, due to the limitations on the size of our product, we're confident this won't be a critical issue. We're working to ensure we can provide worldwide shipping to everyone as economically as possible. 

We have teamed up with Angry Hamster Games to handle our EU and varied world-wide fulfillment. In the UK, Red Dice Games will be handling the Blue Planet: Recontact fulfillment.

Q: What if something happens to the principals?
A: If something were to happen to Jeff or another writer on the project, we've identified our backups, and our team is spread all over the world. It'd take a really big asteroid, zombie apocalypse or alien invasion to wipe us all out. The files and plans have been communicated to the whole team, and a new project lead has already been identified.

*IMPORTANT NOTE*
We hold rewards for a year from fulfillment start date, after which we can no longer promise that we'll be able to fulfill your rewards. We're a small company with limited space, and while we've never had an issue, it's better to be clear about our practices so you're aware. Once we start shipping, if your reward gets returned, or your fulfillment info wasn't provided, we'll give you a full calendar year to sort out the issues and will still ship your rewards. After a year, we may no longer have the rewards, or we might require you to pay updated shipping charges, as they are always going up.
