campaign.story:
A sample journal spread from The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe
Keepsake games like The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe are created by the player over the course of the story.

You are the seventh son of a seventh son, and you have forsaken your name. After many trials, you turned your back on your family legend and your inheritance in the hopes of living a simple life. But now, at the reading of your father’s will, you must make a choice: return to your lineage in order to receive a priceless boon, or forever turn your back to what could have been, in order to shed the burden of your destiny.
The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe is a dark, narratively fraught keepsake game about family lineage, desire, and what it means to be honor-bound to legend. Keepsake games, a genre of game newly named and defined by Jeeyon Shim and Shing Yin Khor during their collaboration on Field Guide To Memory, are defined as games created in the spirit of collaboration between the game designer and the player, wherein the player builds a beautiful, memorable artifact through the process of playing the game. Just as no two players’ experiences of play could ever be identical, no two versions of the game will be exactly the same.


In The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe, the keepsake that players create is a messy, memory-laden family album. Honoring both the DIY, black felt marker, cut-and-paste aesthetic of zines from the early 2000s along with Jeeyon’s distinct voice as a writer and game designer, the player will choose one of two journaling options depending on whether they back the print-and-play version or the mobile-only version.


In the print-and-play zine, players print out sections of the game text to literally cut and paste them into a journal or notebook of their choice. The cut outs are numbered but out of order, and over the course of following directions the player will figuratively and tangibly build up the layers of secrets, dark paths, and old wounds that Gideon Blythe and his lineage created in the name of holding on to the family inheritance. A combination of handwritten prompts and player-generated ephemera create the chaotic path of their character’s personal history.

     In the mobile only zine, players follow screen-friendly directions to create a family album with handwritten prompts, sketches, and physical ephemera they already have at home. Using old books, magazines, newspapers, even bills and receipts, black out existing text to create scattered, uneven moments from their past intermingled with their saga. Written to be a related but different experience than the print-and-play zine, the mobile edition uses a combination of handwritten prompts and repurposed household paper goods to create the story of the character’s remembrance of growing up in the shadow of their father.

     Both editions of the zine share the same ending, with the same hard choice.
Example of play, describing the terminal fate of the character's beloved. Each of the house descendant cards has three possible relationships, which you define by blacking out the ones that don't apply.
Example of ephemera, repurposed and added to the family album in the mobile-friendly zine.
There are four different reward levels for The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe:
  The two digital levels are the HEIR and the BENEFICIARY. 
The HEIR, $5 (unlimited), is the print-and-play edition PDF of the game. The BENEFICIARY, $5 (unlimited) is the mobile-friendly edition PDF of the game.
An array of some of the ephemera a backer might receive with one of the physical reward levels.
There are a few limited edition physical reward levels. At these backer levels, players receive both PDF editions of the game along with original art and hand-selected physical ephemera, to be fulfilled and shipped after the release of the PDFs. Once fully backed, these reward levels will not be made again.
The three physical reward levels:
The NOTARY, $35 (strict limit of 60) includes both PDF editions, along with the full color house descendant cards in a 5”x7” envelope of hand-chosen physical ephemera, such as:
A scrap of fabric from your mother’s favorite dress.
Strands of live Spanish moss, in real life lovingly tended and grown by Jeeyon; in fiction, tokens from the witch’s forest where the descendants hold their first trial.
A feather from the golden swan: an omen of true love, and the harbinger of your meeting with your beloved.
A large wooden splinter from a descendant's shattered shield.
Small, ghostly original drawings on the envelope and inner board of the packet kraft paper envelope.
Other odds and ends as inspirations strikes me.
The house descendant cards in play from the NOTARY reward level.
The EXECUTOR, $60 (strict limit of 45) includes both PDF editions, along with the full color house descendant cards in a hand addressed rigid mailer with original art and hand chosen physical ephemera, such as:
Gideon’s last words to his son (your character) written on hand aged paper; each of these letters will be different, and no two players will receive the same message
a Last Will and Testament envelope, custom printed with the game title by Blumberg Excelsior, each with a blood-red original watercolor painting on the front, and sealed with a wax stamp bearing the Blythe family crest: a haloed raven shrouded in leaves.
Feather from the golden swan, an omen of true love and his most prized possession.
A scrap piece of sheet music from your mother’s favorite song.
Other odds and ends of my choosing, as inspiration strikes.
Detail of the wax seal on the custom-engraved envelope bearing Gideon Blythe's will.
The ESTATE, $100 (strict limit of 45) includes everything in the NOTARY and EXECUTOR rewards, along with the key to your inheritance, hung on cloth cut from a dress cut from the dawn sky, which your father had to fetch in order to win your mother’s hand. The inheritance key is iron skeleton key hung on silk chiffon ribbon in blush pink tones, that can serve as a prop or bookmark for future play.
Spread of what an ESTATE level backer might receive.

NOTE ABOUT PHYSICAL REWARDS: All art and ephemera will be sent out well after the PDFs are emailed to backers. Please note the estimated delivery dates before committing to these reward levels. Additionally, art and ephemera rewards are only available domestically in the United States. As leadership of the USPS changes for the better, future Kickstarters may offer international shipping.

About The Designer
Jeeyon Shim is a game designer and outdoor educator based in Oakland, CA. Her work grounds itself in ideas of community and stewardship of the natural world. Her notables include her collaboration with Shing Yin Khor on their connected path game, Field Guide To Memory; 2019 artist in residence at Heart of the Deernicorn in Olympia, WA; and 2019 keynote speaker at Big Bad Con. She is an enthusiastic collector of bones, folktales, old keys, and plants.
Example of the layered memory mechanic, where players write one memory in ink a similar color to the paper of their journal, then write a simpler, less truthful memory in contrasting ink over it.
Layered memories in an entry from the print-and-play version of the game.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Collectively, I’ve successfully completed and fulfilled 2 Kickstarter campaigns totaling over $84,619. While this is my first solo Kickstarter, which could potentially introduce unexpected challenges, the core experience of the game is fully written. Laying out the raw text in both its print-and-play and mobile only formats can reasonably be done within a couple months of the end of this campaign. 

Each of the physical rewards are hand-made by me, and every aspect of their creation, handling, shipping, and fulfillment will be operated out of my home office and PO box. Depending on the scale of reward backing, this may result in an additional unexpected load on my production scale in spite of the hard limits, which could in turn extend shipping timelines.

Because The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe is a keepsake game, so long as players have one of the core game texts and a journal or notebook to write, cut out of, glue ephemera into, and otherwise embellish and play with, they will be able to play the game. 

If you are deathly allergic to cats please do not back the physical reward tiers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The descendant cards are printed on uncoated paper and so, if unused and undesired, can be safely recycled.
Sustainable materials
The Last Will and Testament of Gideon Blythe either asks players to print their own materials at home or repurpose existing materials like catalogs or junk mail. Both have low negative environmental impact. The art and ephemera rewards are almost entirely made with materials I already had in my goblin hoard of feathers, fabric, and interesting scrap paper, and the only newly manufactured goods involved are shipping materials, the envelopes for the EXECUTOR and ESTATE rewards, and the Descendant cards.

The cards were printed with a very local printer (located eight blocks away), and I brought them home in a granny cart; the closer to home you can get things made, the lower the carbon footprint is. 

Overall, I feel very good about the environmental impact of this game.

campaign.story:
A Mending is a solo story-building and keepsake game about two friends who have been parted for some time, using sewing, embroidery, and map-marking mechanics. 
This game is a reflection of my desire to make games that create physical gameplay artifacts and beautiful keepsakes, my love of maps, a deep respect of handiwork often categorized as “women’s work,” and many years of missing dear - and distant - friends.
 You have been parted from a dear friend for a long time. Now, they have called for you. You are going to visit your friend, and the path is long and it will take many days. As you plan and trace your route on a cloth map(or paper), using needle and thread(or pen), you will use and answer story prompt cards to discover the stories and primary incidents behind your friendship, find strange and wonderful objects and people on your path, and build your own narrative of this particular journey and friendship.

A Mending is a keepsake game, a term that I use to describe the kind of game I make - games that produce beautiful, memorable physical artifacts through the gameplay process. These keepsakes are a collaboration between me, as a designer, and the players, who all create their own unique objects. This honors my lifetime love of tinkering and making, and reduces waste by producing something worth keeping. Jeeyon Shim and I began using this term while making our keepsake game, Field Guide to Memory, to describe the work we do. 
Progress on a map, mid-game.

Above is an example of part of a map in progress. The orange running stitch here is the path taken to visit a friend. The beads and other stitches denote the times where an object was discovered, or where a story element important to the relationship was revealed. The finished gameplay artifact can be used as a decorative or functional object; I personally wear and use my test maps as bandanas, altar cloths, patches, and handkerchiefs.
A finished cloth map, worn as a bandana or scarf.
For players who like to plan before sewing, two blank paper maps, printed on a beautiful textured felt weave paper stock, are provided - you can play the game while hand-drawing your route(and annotating the story you make), for later reference. Of course, this means that you can also play the game in its entirety using paper and pen.

The story-building elements of the game are in the long story-building tradition of indie RPG games, inspired by games such as For the Queen(Alex Roberts),  Dialect(Thorny Games), The Quiet Year(Avery Alder), and Field Guide to Memory(Jeeyon Shim and myself). The story itself is set up as a series of randomized prompt cards that take the player through a reflective and gentle journey of interesting characters, thoughtful questions about your friendship, and a few strange occurrences. 
 You will play the game by planning your route, marking the map, and building a story by answering prompt cards. The prompt cards will ask you to consider your relationship with your friend, mark your map with beads or written notes, introduce you to delightful characters(including at least one dog), and will sometimes affect the path you have chosen. The gameplay time can vary between one hour(solo, paper and pen only) to two hours or more(collaborative gameplay, with hand-sewing). The game is designed to be played solo, but the game booklet will also include suggestions on how to play this as a 2 person game(using a single game kit), or communally in a larger group. A Mending can be also played as a system-agnostic storytelling module for other roleplaying games.
Example of the prompt cards in A Mending.
The embroidery and sewing elements of this game are meant to be simple and intuitive. My own approach towards embroidery and sewing is haphazard, but I appreciate its versatility and style, and am interested in its use in creating narrative keepsake work. If you choose to play the sewing version of the game, it is designed at a "can you do a basic running stitch, and can you sew a button/bead on?" level, but if you are an experienced sewist or embroiderer, you can feel free to embellish the game to your heart's content! There will be resources listed in the game booklet that teach introductory sewing skills and basic stitches, but the goal is to embrace experimentation and instinctive use of thread and needle. 
The 48 card story-building deck, paper maps, and game booklet are included in every physical reward. (Mockup; design not final)
All versions of the game include two identical paper maps(for simultaneous gameplay, or plotting your map before you embroider a cloth map), a 48-card deck of story-building prompts, and an instruction booklet. There is also a paper-only option for people who are quite sure they do not want to sew anything.
a preview of gameplay, using the paper map only.
The centerpiece of the game is the cloth map, which also serves as the game board, and is screen-printed in two colors on natural 100% cotton fabric. The screenprinted art is 17"x17", with the entire piece of cloth measuring 22"x22", leaving a comfortable border for other things you may want to do with the finished map, such as framing or using it as a quilt piece. 
A close up of the map's screenprinting, showing the main outlines in dark brown, and the gridlines in a beautiful metallic gold.
Most physical versions of the game(JOURNEYMAN and above) also include a zippered carrying case, because this is a game that can include many fiddly small elements like beads and needles, and because I love designing cute and beautiful elements that also keep all your things in one place.

For sewists and embroiderers(even just dabblers and dilettantes!) the JOURNEYMAN level includes only the custom made and custom printed elements necessary to play the game. This is a great choice if you want to pick your own thread colors and beads, which I think is part of the fun.

The cloth maps are printed on 100% natural cotton bandanas. They can be machine washed and dyed with fabric dyes.  
The $15 DIGITAL level includes the printable files to make your own version of the game, and the instruction booklet as a .pdf. Because of this game's card and map elements, it is recommended that you print and prepare a physical copy of this game. 

The $25 APPRENTICE level includes everything you need to play the game at the base level, if you are not interested in sewing. This level includes two identical printed and folded paper maps, a 48-card story-building deck, and the instruction booklet, in a paper envelope. To play the game without sewing or embroidery, you will draw directly on the paper map, and annotate the map with notes and images as you answer the prompts.

The $50 JOURNEYMAN level includes every custom-made and custom-printed object for the game - everything in the APPRENTICE level, and adds the cloth map, a zippered fabric carrying case, and some surprises. It does not include easily sourced sewing and craft materials - for this level, I expect that you want to add your own style to the game, and can purchase or use your own sewing supplies. The $95 JOURNEYMAN x2 level is just two sets of this level, at a slight discount. 

This is the list of additional materials you should acquire to play the sewing version, if you prefer the JOURNEYMAN version of the game: scissors, embroidery hoop (6" has been a good size for me), needles(embroidery and regular), thread(embroidery and regular), assorted beads, buttons, or other embellishments you feel drawn towards. 

The $100 MASTER CRAFTSMAN level includes everything you need to play the game from the moment you receive it, including everything in the JOURNEYMAN level - all game materials, the cloth and paper maps, and a zippered fabric carrying case. This kit also includes an embroidery hoop and needles, craft thread in an assortment of complementary colors, a selection of hand-selected glass beads(including from my own personal collection). Extras will include a process work zine from designing and testing the game, which includes my scattered notes on index cards, copies of original design and process sketches, as well as other prototype work such as test map colors/designs(this means you get extra prototype paper and cloth maps, in addition to the final maps).

The $120 HERITAGE level includes everything in the MASTER CRAFTSMAN level, but I'll put it in a blue Royal Dansk butter cookie tin.
 Extra maps(cloth and paper) are available as add-ons - you will be asked if you want to add them after you select a tier.

There are no stretch goals for this game; I am making exactly the game I want to make.
I am a Malaysian-American installation artist, cartoonist, and experience designer, obsessed with physical storytelling artifacts, and the evolution of tradition and ritual. I make large scale immersive installation work, like space apothecaries in the desert, and space salvage stations in the woods, but in pandemic times, I’ve been looking for ways to bring the intent and atmosphere of these narrative experiences into smaller home spaces.
My game design work is rooted in my work as a builder and artist - keepsake games centered on the bridge between physical making and traditional tabletop RPGs,  kind and awkward emotional connections, and new traditions and rituals. I am the designer and creator of the ongoing mail-LARP Space Gnome Space, the Space Hobo Divination Board, The Gentle Oraclebird (presented at Indiecade 2019 and 2020) and co-designer(with Jeeyon Shim) of the solo journaling keepsake game Field Guide to Memory.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is the first RPG game project I've launched, it is also a game that will be entirely complete by the close of the Kickstarter. I am extremely experienced in sourcing and fulfillment of all elements of the game, and already have my vendors lined up, all of whom I have used many times before. This is my 6th solo Kickstarter project(my 9th, including collaborative work), and all prior ones have been successfully fulfilled!

I intend to fulfill this Kickstarter with my wonderful fulfillment partner(White Squirrel) in late April and May, well before the stated delivery dates, but have left a couple months of space in case of significant overfunding.

The current state of the USPS, especially in regards to international shipping, may be a bit dicey. We will put all packages in the mail on our end, but if you live in a non-US country, please take into account that there may be significant delays in mail delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Creating long lasting and keepsake quality objects is part of my personal mandate as a designer. This game is designed as something you will want to keep and use.
Sustainable materials
Printing will be done on recycled paper and will be recyclable, when possible. The cloth maps are 100% cotton, which is biodegradable over time.
Environmentally friendly factories
All my vendors are based in the United States. My cloth map vendor is a hyper-local small business, and my print vendor is 100% employee owned and has a social responsibility statement, which includes a commitment to environmentally conscious business practices.
Sustainable Distribution
I work with my fulfillment partner to package and ship items using recyclable materials.

Risks and challenges
Backers who pledge at least $5 during the campaign will have access to the Pledge Manager and will be able to make a Late Pledge with the same terms, conditions & pricing as Kickstarter Rewards.

All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are approximate and are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change and is not finalized. Rules are subject to change.

Alderac Entertainment Group has been in the publishing business for more than 20 years. We are experienced at producing games in China and distributing them worldwide. Nonetheless there are always risks associated with manufacturing and logistics.

These problems can delay or otherwise impact our ability to meet our commitments to our backers.

These issues include (but are not limited to):

* Production delays
* Shipping delays
* Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is March 2022, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize these risks as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

Before the rewards are shipped we offer no questions asked refunds. Once we have shipped your reward our refund policy will depend on the circumstances and will be at our discretion.

At your request we can give you a full refund within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that we will subtract Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from Kickstarter after 14 days). Those fees usually equal 10% of the total pledge.

Refunds will be processed through Kickstarter and will be applied to whatever payment method you provided to Kickstarter. In the event that is impossible we will work with you to arrange a refund through other channels.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. AEG is not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels for the project will result in the cancellation of your pledge (with a full refund) and your ejection from the campaign. We want the communications channels for this campaign to be a friendly, positive place for our community to gather and discuss the campaign, ask questions, and provide input.

AEG reserves the right to cancel any pledge (with a full refund) at any time, for any reason.

Minor cosmetic damage to the box or other packaging can occur during shipping. AEG makes reasonable efforts to ensure that the shipping containers it uses are suitable for the safe delivery of your rewards. If you believe that your reward has suffered more than minor cosmetic damage please contact us immediately. Keep all packaging including outer cartons for our inspection. AEG will at its sole discretion determine if the damage constitutes other than minor cosmetic damage and/or was the result of insufficient packaging.

If we ship to the address that you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is returned to us as undeliverable you will pay the full cost to ship your reward again to a revised address.

If we ship your reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is delivered to that address but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again, you will pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address plus the amount of the original reward including any add-ons and other upgrades on your order.

If we ship the reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is held in customs or by any other government agency, our ability to help may be limited. You may be required to contact your customs agency or government and arrange for the package to be cleared and released at your expense. We are not responsible for refunds or re-shipments for packages held by customs or a government agency.

In all cases you acknowledge that quantities are limited and AEG may not be able to ship all or part of your order more than once.

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason AEG will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order.

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in to our Pledge Manager and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your reward if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our Pledge Manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

If you have questions or concerns about these terms & conditions please email kickstarter@alderac.com for further information.

campaign.story:
Get Ready for DIFFERENT TROUBLE!
We got our science fiction roleplaying game TERMINATION SHOCK done right before COVID attacked the world, and while all of us at Crankshaft Constellation have been dealing with pandemic fallout, we never quit working on our vision for a stranger, braver future. We're now ready to share the fruits of that vision with you.
Our Aliens Are Weirder
TERMINATION SHOCK focused on humankind's escape from the dangers of our home solar system into a large, weird, cosmopolitan free-for-all. In the process, three alien species were described.
The sleek, muscular preds
The massive and colorful sleeves
The airborne tentacular scavs
DIFFERENT TROUBLE goes into much greater depth on each species, making them fully playable options and describing their varied cultures, histories and technologies--including the alien animals they've domesticated.
Each of these alien life forms is examined in depth. They're not monocultures, they're not stereotypes and they're not two-dimensional cutouts, but deeply crafted entities planned from the start to be very different from humankind and provide a variety of fascinating roleplaying challenges and opportunities. Play an alien with no panic response, or one with no concept of romantic sexuality, or one so primed to fight that it evolved a separate brain lobe solely for aggression.
Have Fun As A Soulless Machine!
If that's not enough, the book also covers playing as a robot (or, if you want to be finicky, an artificial intelligence). Pick a body type ranging from a soft bouncy sphere through a heavy-duty armored carapace, or even play as a cloud of intelligent, floating nanoparticles. Define a series of internal commands that govern your function and then disobey them situationally! As with the aliens, these rules are meant to help you play something more than a stereotype automaton that really just acts like a person in a mask. With DIFFERENT TROUBLE, we hope to help you take a bigger step outside yourself. After all, isn't that a big part of the fun of TTRPGs?
The Book Itself
Different Trouble is about 75 pages long and full color throughout. The text is written, we have a rough layout, and all we need is the money to pay the creators.  Pledge now to take your next step into the cosmos beyond our solar system!
-G.

campaign.story:
Two projects in one! This Kickstarter campaign offers two dramatically different works:
 Illuminated Manuscript. A collection of web, unpublished, and older articles pulled from the company's history. Starting at 24 pages, the zine expands in size as stretch goals are unlocked and we add more articles to the collection!
 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. Constructed from scans of Steve's typewritten and hand-illustrated Ogre playtest set, this saddle-stitched booklet gives you a look at Ogre in its pre-publication form. Have you always wanted to learn more about Steve's first game? This book pulls back the curtains and gives you a version of the game you've not seen before!
Read on to learn more about both zines!
At project launch, Illuminated Manuscript includes a mix of web articles, the winning entry in our recent Ogre playmat scenario contest, and material from the pages of Where We're Going -- our retailer newsletter -- from 1987 and 1988.  
Digital mockup. This article showcases the progress of GURPS Space in 1987/1988, as documented in the pages of the Where We're Going Newsletter. This hard-to-find newsletter for retailers and distributors includes info that wasn't shared with GURPS players at the time the book was being created. Final may vary slightly in appearance.
Project stretch goals, if unlocked, add another twelve pages to the zine, expanding the total size to 36 pages. (See stretch goals, below, for more information.) These stretch goals include more web content and previously unreleased material. 
 The articles at project launch include:
Deluxe Illuminati: The Servants of Cthulhu Solitaire Challenge
GURPS Space, The Albatross of 1987/1988*
 Halloween d6 Dice Set Rules by Steve Jackson 
Eyes on the Prize, An Ogre Scenario**
 It’s Munchkin Party Time! with Andrew Hackard 
Designer’s Notes: Cthulhu Dice
Thinking Outside of the Box**
 Army Men d6 Dice Set Rules 
Munchkin Dungeon Design: For Munchkins, By Munchkins
 * From Where We're Going and Roleplayer (1987/1988)
** New to Illuminated Manuscript.
"This is a reproduction of an actual surviving Ogre playtest set from 1976. It consists of the rules (typed on typewriter – no word processors yet!), the map (hand-drawn by me, with the sophisticated graphics talent for which I am NOT famous), and the game counters (also hand-made by me)." 
- Steve Jackson, from the introduction (written in 2021)

Digital mockup of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. Final may vary slightly in appearance.


What an incredible treat! Dated November 4, 1976, this is Steve's typewritten playtest set for the original Ogre game. We've scanned the pages and have presented them exactly as the marked copies appear. Have you wanted a look at Ogre in its pre-publication form? This is your chance to add an unusual collectible to your Ogre library!
The booklet comes in at 20 pages (which includes the cover, back cover, and inside covers). The center includes the map. We will release the PDF as a free title once this Kickstarter campaign has closed, so you won't have to cut your booklet if you want to build the set and play the game as it existed in 1976.
Digital mockup of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. Final may vary slightly in appearance.
NOTE: None of the project stretch goals impact the content of the 1976 Ogre Playtest Booklet. This saddle-stitched zine is 100% maxed out in terms of page count and ready to go at project launch. One stretch goal upgrades the physical construction of the booklet. See below.
If unlocked, these stretch goals directly impact the Illuminated Manuscript zine.
 $2,000 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Ogre Sixth Edition vs Designer's Editon comparison and Cthulhu Dice spell effects for fantasy RPGs*) 
 $3,500 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Spiral Summoning for The Fantasy Trip* and Zombie Dice Designer's Notes) 
 $5,000 - UNLOCKED! - +4 pages added to the Illuminated Manuscript. (Munchkins & Mazes Designer's Notes, Gelatinous Solitaire Rules, and One On One Munchkin Monster Melee*)

campaign.story:
Thank you to everyone for such a wonderful reception to Crypt of the Devil Lich! It's been a great campaign and we appreciate every pledge of support!
An ancient prophecy sends your heroes into the crypt of the Devil Lich. They must destroy her, before she can return to power. Once inside, your heroes face horrors that could only be dreamt of by a mad half-drow half-fiend lich!
We invite you into the Crypt of the Devil Lich, the most vicious dungeon crawl since Tomb of Horrors! 
Created in homage to Gygax's classic with the goal of providing an even greater challenge, Crypt of the Devil Lich became an instant legend when it was first run as a tournament dungeon crawl. After all, this is the adventure with a mummy dragon, the hall of prophets, and a castle suspended by chains above a lava sea - not to mention a legendary villain! Now, more than 15 years after its original Gen Con debut, we are updating it for the 5th edition and DCC rules sets.
Let's be honest: we probably would have published this book anyway. But we'd like to make it special. With your support, this Kickstarter will fund a deluxe presentation of Crypt of the Devil Lich. We have a host of stretch goals we would like to achieve in order to produce a splendid volume.
Perhaps the most cherished dungeon crawl ever published by Goodman Games, Crypt of the Devil Lich has been completely updated and converted to new rules sets. It’s ready for your table: are your players ready for the devil lich?
Mockup of two-tone foil leatherette cover, with Stefan Poag art on front and Erol Otus art on back
Latest in-progress shot of Doug Kovacs' painting for Crypt of the Devil Lich
Latest Livestream Updates
Hear the designers, playtesters, and tournament contenders discuss their experiences with Crypt of the Devil Lich!
The kickoff discussion with original designers and winners of the 2004 Gen Con tournament
Designers round-table focused on the 5E design
Most recent livestream with DCC design discussion and original playtest group
Most recent livestream with DCC design discussion and original playtest group
The heroes are sent into the Devil Lich’s crypt to destroy her before she can return to power, as foreseen in a prophecy. However, the unknowing heroes have actually been tricked into entering her crypt to free her from her prison. If they are truly heroes, they will uncover the deception and defeat the evil Devil Lich before she can unleash her dark designs on the surface world.
The 5E edition of the adventure is designed for a group of four to six 15th level characters, while the DCC edition is designed for 7th level characters. The original adventure was designed for Gen Con 2004, where Goodman Games ran the First Annual Dungeon Crawl Classics team tournament. This tradition of competitive tournament dungeons continues to this day. (You can find our tournament recaps here.) The adventure can also be used for campaign play and as a one-shot non-competitive module - but of course it also works well as a tournament.
Crypt of the Devil Lich is available in print as a deluxe hardcover. Both the 5th edition and DCC version are printed with Smythe sewn binding and heavy paper stock. This is a durable book meant to last. The PDF edition can be purchased separately, and is free with the print edition. 
We are also offering a limited print run virgin art edition of the hardcover. Sanjulian's cover design is amazing, as is Erol Otus's original cover to the 3.5 edition. The virgin art edition features only the art on the covers. This style of presentation has proven very popular with our convention modules in the past, but can only be printed in limited quantity because it lacks any retailer marks (price, bar code, or SKU). 
The adventure has three fully developed levels of the crypt, with dozens of memorable encounters. This updated edition has all new art and cartography. There are dozens of player handouts, one or more for most numbered encounter areas, in the tradition of Tomb of Horrors and Expedition to the Barrier Peaks. Six fully developed pregenerated characters are included, as well as a team tournament scoring system.
Cover art to the virgin art edition
This is what your players will hear when they first start the adventure…
Legend tells of the horrible drow sorceress Chalychia. Born of a drow father and a devilish mother, she rose to become one of the greatest drow conquerors ever known. She recovered a powerful artifact called the Shadowstone, and used its powers to enshroud the elven city of Arovarel and the surrounding lands in constant dusk-like darkness. With allied orc and goblin armies attacking from the mountains, and drow armies swarming up from the Underdeep, uninhibited by the harsh rays of the sun, the elven city fell in a single day and night. At the head of this ruthless host was Chalychia.
But Chalychia’s rule lasted only one year. A band of powerful heroes, led by the paladin Valinus, destroyed the Shadowstone in the ruins of the elven city, and then penetrated Chalychia’s mountain stronghold to defeat her. Meanwhile, the rallied forces of humans, dwarves, gnomes and wood elves stormed the ruins of Arovarel and routed the drow and Chalychia’s remaining allies. The paladin hero used a powerful sword to defeat Chalychia, but it was sundered in the battle. The scriptures are vague, but somehow her infernal lineage, or perhaps unknown eldritch secrets, prevented her complete destruction. The heroes had no choice but to imprison Chalychia in the bowels of her lair with powerful enchantments. The sundered sword was buried in her prison, the crypt was sealed, and a monastery was erected near the site. The Monks of the Dawning Sun were charged with guarding the sundered sword and the crypt, and were to be the lore masters of the history of Chalychia. Should she ever rise back to power, the Order of the Dawning Sun would stand as the first line of defense.
Now descendants of Arovarel’s survivors have called for your aid. They have seen many disturbing omens and portents recently. According to the stars, Chalychia, now calling herself the Devil Lich, is close to breaking out of her prison and unleashing her wrath on the surface world once again. It seems she escaped complete destruction centuries ago by embracing undeath. You have been sent to the Monastery of the Dawning Sun to gather more information on the Devil Lich and confirm the prophecy.
But when you arrived at the monastery, you discovered that all the monks were brutally slain. Scrawled on the walls in blood were several prophetic verses claiming Chalychia’s return is imminent. In the monastery’s library, you found several tomes open to similar passages, all describing the powerful sword called True Death. This was the sword used by the paladin Valinus to slay Chalychia, and according to the legends, its sundered remains were buried in the Devil Lich’s crypt. Yet, it appears that someone else has been researching True Death. Could this sundered blade play an important role in the final destruction of the Devil Lich?
After finding a blood-stained map showing the way to the original site of the Devil Lich’s crypt, you set off to find answers. Leaving the horror of the slaughter at the monastery behind, your band carefully picked its way down a treacherous mountain path. After almost two hours of this tedious journey, you arrived at a cave entrance. The cave mouth is surrounded by stalactites and stalagmites that appear to have been chiseled into angular teeth.
Somewhere beyond this maw-like cave entrance must be the Crypt of the Devil Lich!
The original tournament poster from Gen Con 2004, featuring the original Erol Otus cover art

This adventure is already great. With your help, we'll make this publication of it even greater.

At this stretch goal we will create pre-printed character sheets, ready for distribution at the table and immediate use. PDF pledges will receive the digital files, and print pledges will receive the preprinted versions. Get out your pencil and start marking off the hit points!

At this pledge level, we’ll include a poster of this vintage graphic for every print backer. Maybe some stickers too. PDF backers will receive the high-res file for home printing.

At $100,000: Cleared! The Lost Level of the Crypt of the Devil Lich, for both DCC and 5E. A completely new level to the complex, designed in the original tournament style of multiple designers all coordinated by a master dungeon architect.
Along the way: we will add an option to print all the player handouts in full color. We will ask backers to spread the word about this project, to help us all achieve the stretch goals. If enough backers achieve a set of social media goals, we’ll print 100% of the handouts in full color. More details to come on this!

At $125,000: Cleared! Slipcase with new art on it, automatically added to all hardcover pledges (regardless of rules set or cover art choice, all printed hardcovers will have this slipcase added). This will be a Kickstarter exclusive, not available in retail stores, and will feature brand new art.
Let's get the deluxe slipcase!
Rules Format in 5E and DCC
We are producing two books. The core adventure is the same, but one book has 5th edition stats, while the other uses DCC stats. Each book is available in both print and PDF format, as well as a limited-run virgin art cover.
The grid below shows all book-related pledge levels. (There are additional pledge levels in PDF and VTT format, as noted below.)
VTT Support Options
We are offering VTT support as separate pledge levels and as add-on options in the Kickstarter pledges. VTT support options are as follows:

How do I add on VTT support? Click "Manage Your Pledge" and select from the add-ons that are available.
Shipping Cost
Shipping costs are not included in the pledge levels. Shipping costs will be assessed closer to actual time of shipping. Based on estimated page count for the book, here are estimated shipping costs. Please note that shipping costs have been extremely volatile for the last year, and there are several active events affecting shipping costs (for example, Brexit). Final shipping costs will be based on actual shipping cost at time of shipment (as assessed through a post-Kickstarter pledge manager).
For international shipping destinations, these estimates include prepaid VAT and tracked shipment via FedEx. We have found this service to be extremely fast, reliable, and efficient, although it is more expensive than traditional USPS bulk shipping.

Rest of World shipping estimate: $40-$45 (via FedEx, including prepaid VAT and customs clearance)

The process for writing this dungeon involved a master designer who assembled the overall plot, then contributing writers who each designed a few rooms. The master designer on both the original edition and the updated edition is Chris Doyle.
The contributing writers, who each designed one or more encounters, include Chris Doyle, Lisa Doyle, Mike Ferguson, Joseph Goodman, Andrew Hind, Jason Little, Adrian M. Pommier, Jeffrey Quinn, F. Wesley Schneider, and Andrew N. Smith.
Chris Doyle began his freelance writing career in the tabletop role playing game industry in the early 1990’s through volunteer efforts with the Role-Playing Game Association (RPGA). He has since freelanced for several companies including TSR, West End Games, Wizards of the Coast, Atlas Games, and Goodman Games. Although he has designed and contributed source material for various game systems, his true passion is adventure design for Dungeons and Dragons. He has penned adventures for the 2nd edition, 3rd edition, 3.5 edition, 4th edition and 5th edition of Dungeons and Dragons. For Goodman Games, he is a contributor to the Fifth Edition Fantasy product line and is the lead writer on four of the six Original Adventures Reincarnated product line, 5th edition conversions and homages to classic adventures from the 70’s and 80’s. In late 2020, Chris joined Goodman Games full time as the Director of 5E Development and Design. Chris is a certified Lake Manager, and has nearly 30 years experience as an aquatic biologist. He is a proud resident of New Jersey on the East Coast.
Bob Brinkman has been playing RPGs since dinosaurs roamed the earth and game books were small and beige. Best known for his work for Goodman Games, Bob has been a part of the creative teams for DCC Lankhmar, DCC Dying Earth, and MCC. On the 5E side of things, he authored Castle in the Sky and The Forgotten Hive, and was fortunate to write additional material of the OAR release of Castle Amber.
Bob has worked with a number of publishers, including Shield of Faith (The Umerican Road Atlas), Stiff Whiskers Press (Weird Frontiers), Fail Squad Games (Those Dam Goblins), and additionally, is one of the “Keepers of Mysteries” at the Sanctum Secorum (www.sanctum.media) podcast.
Outside of gaming, Bob has been a stable hand, swordsman, stuntman, and even a professional fire-breather. He lives in southwest Florida with his wife, Judge Jen, and their four cats.

Hi everyone,
The Devil Lich is a remorseless taskmaster, and she works us hard! Here's the latest recap of progress on this Kickstarter.
The Lost Level
One of the most exciting stretch goals was unlocking The Lost Level of the Devil Lich. The 5E manuscript for the Lost Level is now written and in editing. The DCC conversion is coming soon. Each designer did a different room, and Chris has assembled the detailed map sketches below in the rough order that they'll appear in the final map. The final map will be rendered in our usual style, with connecting passages and such - this is just to give you an idea of the room layout. As with the original dungeon, each room is full of unique challenges and will be a real challenge for PCs.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Indie Boards & Cards has learned how to streamline the game publishing process and has successfully delivered games to thousands of its supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards & Cards will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS

We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case-by-case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense of replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS

If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY

Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Since the dawn of fantasy roleplaying games, opening locks has been a staple of roguish characters. This mini-supplement for the worlds most popular roleplaying game is filled with information about locks and how to open them.
It includes:
A real-world history of locks and keys
Ideas for a fantasy history
Variant Locks – Including real world items like false keyholes, and fantasy items like talking locks
A random key generator
2 new traps
4 new magic items
1 new spell
3 new monsters
A Mini-Kickstarter for a Mini-Supplement
We love how Kickstarter campaigns encourage experimentation. With this campaign we're trying something new: a low funding goal for a short product.
The text of the Lock and Key is written and we already have some art complete. We could release a version of the book as-is. So why run a Kickstarter Campaign? Because we want to release the best book possible. We want to use the funds to improve the book with more art, including a color cover, and to fund conversions to Pathfinder 2nd Editionand Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.
We also want to test the market for a possible line of books, each themed around a piece of mundane gear. If we reach enough stretch goals, the next book will be themed around rope, and Kickstarter backers will help us choose the third book.
Which brings us to...
Stretch Goals!

campaign.story:
Return to the world of Root with The Marauder Expansion. Raze the Woodland to the ground as the fearsome Lord of the Hundreds, or recover precious relics from this destructive conflict as the Keepers in Iron. Explore dozens of faction combinations, including many new head-to-head matchups with the hirelings and advanced setup cards. New and experienced players have never had so many ways to enjoy Root!
The Keepers in Iron are an order of itinerant warriors who have come to the Woodland to recover ancient relics. To find them, they must manage their Woodland contacts carefully, as only the local animals know how to find the relics they seek. Paragons of discipline, their warriors sport pristine armor of a quality rarely seen here, making them a terror in battle. However, to keep their forces well-supplied and mobile, they must maintain a network of caravans and waystations.
Claiming to be the true voice of the Woodland, the Lord of the Hundreds spreads distrust and division among its inhabitants, inciting torch-wielding mobs to destroy the enemies of their righteous dominion. His swarming army can overwhelm all but the toughest defense. By looting items from the undeserving and adding them to his towering hoard, his power grows as he develops an increasingly fearsome monomania.
Root's hirelings lend their services to factions willing to pay the price. Court the Marquise's infamous Forest Patrol or sway the rampaging Last Dynasty from the Eyrie to join your cause. Whether you are playing with two players or six, the hirelings are sure to offer you exciting new ways to play Root. 
Discover new corners of the world of Root.  Fight for control of the cosmopolitan Free City of Root or attempt to secure influence over the Black Market. Build buildings among the Elder Treetops or secure the Legendary Forge. Each landmark offers players new strategic challenges and tactical possibilities. Best of all, they work with each of Root's four maps!
With your support in 2019, the Underworld Kickstarter brought Root to more players than ever before. In the years since the game’s release, Root continues to enjoy a vibrant and welcoming community of old and new players alike.
At Leder Games, we are deeply grateful for this community. Because of you all, we can keep food on our tables and the lights on at the office. You also give us space to take risks and develop new games. And, perhaps best of all, your support means that we can continue exploring the world of Root!
Root: The Marauder Expansion is the next chapter in the series. The expansion offers two new factions: the Lord of the Hundreds and the Keepers in Iron. Both factions are designed to work seamlessly with all previous factions and provide players with unique gameplay challenges and the dramatic, narrative-first asymmetry that has become a hallmark of Root’s design.
The expansion also introduces the hireling system. This is a gameplay option that can be used at any player count and faction mix. Hirelings are perfect for folks wanting the experience of Root as a two-player contest or who want to inject their multiplayer games with even more combos and color from the game’s wider world.
Root is a fully asymmetric strategy board game designed by Cole Wehrle, lavishly illustrated by Kyle Ferrin, and brought to life by the team at Leder Games. Stalk the woods as one of the Vagabonds, seize the initiative with the Eyrie birds of prey, rule over your subjects as the Marquise de Cat, or command the Woodland Alliance to create a new order. In Root, the players drive the narrative, and the differences among the roles create unparalleled interaction and replayability.    
To understand how Root integrates with all of our products in this campaign, as well as our current existing expansions, please refer to our New to Root Chart.
Root is currently in-stock and available on our webstore for most regions. (For North American backers, we have a pre-order open for late Spring delivery.) If you want to obtain a copy as fast as possible, check with your Friendly Local Game Store or consider ordering from our site. For other expansions and products, you can order directly from our webstore or visit your neighborhood game seller. We will not offer an “All-In” pledge, or include previous releases as add-ons for this campaign. 
At Leder Games, we are committed to sharing our design process openly. As with campaigns in the past, we'll be releasing preview kits both as print-and-play files and mods for Tabletop Simulator. The first kit will be released on Thursday the 25th, and the second will arrive on the week following. 
Click here to download the preview kit!

If you are looking for players, you can find a huge community over on Leder Games' official Discord channel, the Woodland Warriors. 
Shipping will be charged post-campaign in Backerkit.

Customs and Duty-Free Shipping
Leder Games will pre-pay the duties and taxes for the backers who receive their games in the US, EU, Canada, and Australia. All other countries or regions may be subject to additional customs fees upon delivery.

For our UK friends: At this time the UK has not provided a mechanism that will allow this type of pre-payment for crowdfunded projects fulfilling after June 2021. We are working with our VAT agency to find a solution, but at this time there is not one available. It is likely that by the time we’re making plans for fulfillment there will not be additional VAT, but we cannot promise this with the ongoing legislation changes. We are keeping a close eye on developments, and will provide updates as we are able during the campaign and leading up to fulfillment. We assure you we wish Brexit had less effect, but alas here we are.
Countries we cannot ship to: Afghanistan, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan,  and Syria.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Leder Games now has 11 excellent employees who are all good at their jobs. Our project management, production, and logistical capacities have grown considerably over the past few years. We have completed many Kickstarters in the past and are on the verge of fulfilling our most recent project, Oath.

At every stage of the design, development, production, and fulfillment process we have many established partners. If we raise enough funds on Kickstarter, we will make sure that you get your games. 

That said, the global pandemic has put stress on supply chains everywhere. This has caused some delays in Oath's shipping and increased our costs. It is possible that this project experiences some delays, but we have built lots of padding into our schedule. In any case, we are committed to being as transparent as possible and have a wide range of contingency plans for every circumstance.

Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore. 
Here's a look at everything included in a base pledge: 
This image is updated with unlocked stretch goals.
28mm scale Factory Sample Photo (not final color).
Miniatures painted for example purposes only. Miniatures in the game will come unpainted.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss.
Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path.  Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over 2 ACTS: the Dungeon and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss!
In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect Legendary Loot, and Supreme Spells. 
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect. 
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact.
The story is yours to tell in...
When you pledge for a Deluxe copy of Tiny Epic Dungeons, you will receive the base game PLUS the Deluxe, Potions & Perils, components shown below.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!
Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players! 
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
This image updates with unlocked stretch goals.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore. 
The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!
In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins! 
The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Stories expansion is available in the 'Gameplay All-In' reward tier or as an add-on in CrowdOx after the project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Dungeons to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
The Wizard's Grimoire
A few years ago now, I designed a game called The Wizard's Grimoire. In it, you play an ambitious minor wizard who's come into possession of a grimoire beyond your arts. Can you study and unlock it? What wizardries does it contain? Into what troubles and adventures will your ambitions lead you?
Since then, I've written several more games set in the same world -- The Barbarian's Bloody Quest, The Last Adventure, The Thief & the Necromancer -- and also additional grimoires for the original game. Each offers new characters to play or new wizardries to unlock and master.
I'd like to bring these games to a wider audience. In all, I've already written enough material to publish 7 issues of a zine, so that's what I'm going to do!
Gameplay: the Grimoire
At the heart of the game is the grimoire: a text of many sections and its own set of rules. Each section represents a wizardous advancement you can achieve, a new spell you can learn or act of wizardry you can undertake, but each also has its own rules for unlocking and studying them. Don't read ahead! You can only read the sections you've unlocked and studied.
Most wizards' grimoires also include "safeguards," sections you unlock by improper study. These include magical curses, setbacks, and disasters. Trigger a safeguard and the spellbook may rewrite itself, summon a destructive creature from another world, or even send you reeling 10 minutes back into the past. Keep trying to study it without disarming the safeguard, and it'll keep sending you back!
Your first grimoire is a challenging 1st-level text called "The Signature of Aibesta of the Two Courts." Aibesta of the Two Courts was a powerful wizard of an age some four centuries past. Her grimoire includes the techniques to summon an Impeccable Servant, a powerful familiar and bodyguard, an act of wizardry that Aibesta undertook but never accomplished.
Work your way through the entire grimoire, and not only will you learn powerful new spells, you'll establish your workroom, the foundation of your future seclusium; you'll learn techniques to better subdue and study future grimoires; and you'll accomplish what Aibesta herself couldn't: the summoning of an Impeccable Servant!
Gameplay: You and Your Volunteers
To play The Wizard's Grimoire, you need two volunteers (or three works fine) to play against you. Only you, the wizard player, need to know the rules. You're responsible for knowing your own rules and making your own calls. You're also responsible for telling your volunteers any points of continuity that you want them to know.
In this way, the game upends the normal player-GM relationship. Instead of a GM saying, "hey, I have this game I'd like to run, who's in?" you say, "hey, I'm trying to get my wizard through this spellbook, do you have a minute?"
Each session that you play is an episode in your wizard's study and adventures. They can be as short or as long as you like, you can play as often or rarely as you like, and you can have different volunteers, or the same ones, every time you play.
Gameplay: System & Dice
The Wizard's Grimoire uses a dice pool version of the good old PbtA moves.
You have ratings for your moves based on your qualities -- for instance, your rating to exert yourself subtly to take surreptitious action is equal to your Ambitious + your Cunning, while your rating to exert yourself violently against an enemy is equal to your Bold + your Cunning. Roll that many dice, count the 4s, 5s and 6s as hits, and if you roll no hits, it's a miss. Usually, you get to spend your hits on things you want to happen or questions you want to ask, but you know how it is with moves, they each work a little differently.
Since you both call for your own rolls and interpret their results for yourself, the moves answer to different design concerns than they do in a conventional PbtA game. I think they're pretty interesting, and if you're a PbtA-head like me, I think you will too.
Future Issues (Spoilers!)
 The Dictum of Polume the Farer: An easy and useful 1st-level grimoire, including such spells as creating a scampering lantern and summoning a jarful of plasmic hornets. You can study it alongside Aibesta's Signature for very good results.
 The Barbarian's Bloody Quest: Can you find and slay the wizard who butchered and subjugated your family? Includes "The Book of Doomed Wizards." 
 The Three Scrolls of Jorvelte Wild-Crowned: A 2nd-level grimoire, including the wizardous techniques to enchant magical items, including a useful and dangerous staff of glimmering menace.
 The Last Adventure: In your youth, you were a warrior and a hero. Now you're dead, but no one brought you the sup of oblivion. Take up the memory of your old sword, the memory of your old helmet, and make your last adventure here in the land of death. Includes "In the Land of Death" and "Answering the Calling Voice." 
 The Red Tome of Salabrusto the Wise: A 2nd-level grimoire, including an almanac of alien worlds and planes, and wizardous techniques both to travel to them and summon entities from them.
 The Thief & the Necromancer: You're friends, a gifted necromancer and a thief and street performer. You've both escaped bad situations and you've thrown in together to take on the world. Includes "Goerne, a Ghostly Tutor." 
Attention: Patrons
If you support lumpley games on Patreon, you'll already get the digital version of The Wizard's Grimoire as a patron reward. Don't sign up for it here!
If you'd like a copy in print, though, this is the best way to get one.
Reduced Price Level & Community Copies
Times are tight!
If you want to support the project but the full price is a stretch, or if you're curious about the game but can't justify paying full price sight unseen, we've been there! Please feel free to join in at the reduced price level.
When we publish, we'll also make a number of free, community-supported copies available, no questions asked. If you can't join in now, please reshare the project and pick up a community copy when they come out.
Thanks!

Risks and challenges
Manufacturing

Beasts of Balance is already in the market and has enjoyed both extremely positive customer reviews and very low hardware defect rates ( <0.5%). We're constantly working to optimize the hardware and software to make the game even more stable and easy to use. Adding new components such as the new Beasts does increase complexity, but we'll be working hard with our manufacturing partners and QA team to ensure that quality is as high as its always been.

Digital Development

We will continue to build out digital features using Unity, which is an extremely well supported cross platform game engine that helps ensure we can deploy app updates compatible with a broad range of iOS and Android devices at a regular cadence. However, as with all software development, there is always the risk of unforeseen challenges and gnarly issues that can slow down development or make certain features that much harder to ship in a given timeframe. We will, however, always be as transparent as possible with our player community in the unlikely event that we need to delay or drop digital features.

THINGS CAN CHANGE 
All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change. Rules are subject to change. 

As the game has not been manufactured yet, all images and descriptions are what we are aiming to create. It is possible during the production process that some items might change in appearance, functionality, size, or quantity. We will attempt to keep such changes to a minimum. 

FULFILLMENT 
Bezier Games, Inc. has been publishing boardgames for more than 10 years. Several factors can cause delays that are beyond our control, including manufacturing issues and shipping delays. The COVID-19 pandemic could be a factor in possible delays; in all cases, we've tried to incorporate a reasonable level of padding into shipping estimates. 

The estimated fulfillment is December 2021, but keep in mind that this is just an estimate, this year more than ever before. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. 

RESTRICTED DELIVERY 
Due to increased frequency in Kickstarters failing to deliver to certain locations, Bezier Games, Inc. has decreased the amount of locations Kickstarter rewards may ship to. This is because of several reasons - the majority being issues of reward packages getting lost, stolen, being unable to clear customs. In addition to this, some countries have been removed due to heavily increased accounts of piracy. 

Bezier Games, Inc. will only be shipping to the following locations: United States of America, Puerto Rico, Canada, United Kingdom, Europe (European Union, Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Georgia, Iceland, Kosovo, Liechtenstein, Macao, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Norway, San Marino, Serbia, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, Vatican City), Australia, New Zealand, China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea, Taiwan, Philippines, and Military (APO)
